Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 40:82: Не ходят ли по земята, да видят какъв бе краят на онези преди тях? Те бяха по-многобройни и по-силни от тях, и с повече следи по земята. Ала не ги избави онова, което са придобили.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 40:83: И когато пратениците им донасяха ясните знаци, те ликуваха със своето знание и тогава ги обграждаше онова, на което се присмиваха.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 40:84: И когато виждаха Нашето наказание, казваха: Повярвахме в Аллах, единствено в Него, и отхвърляме онова, с което Го съдружавахме.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 40:85: Но не им бе от полза вярата им, когато виждаха Нашето наказание. Такъв бе обичаят на Аллах спрямо Неговите раби и преди. Неверниците губят.

null.verse 40:2: 這部經典降自萬能全知的主——
null.verse 40:3: 赦宥罪過、准人懺悔、嚴厲懲罰、博施恩惠的主。除他外，絕無應受崇拜的；他確是最後的歸宿。
null.verse 40:4: 只有不信道者，為真主的蹟象而爭論。你不要被他們在各城市的往來所迷惑。
null.verse 40:5: 在他們之前，努哈的宗族，和後來的各民族，都否認眾使者，各民族都欲加害本族的使者；他們據謬妄而爭論，欲借此駁倒真理，故我懲治了他們。我的刑罰是怎樣的？
null.verse 40:6: 不信道者當這樣受你的主的判決，他們是居住火獄的。
null.verse 40:7: 支持寶座的和環繞寶座的，都讚頌他們的主，都歸信他，都為信道者求饒，他們說：「我們的主啊！在恩惠方面和知覺方面，你是包羅萬物的，求你赦宥悔過自新、而且遵循你的正道者。求你保護他們，免受火獄的刑罰。
null.verse 40:8: 我們的主啊！求你讓他們和他們的行善的祖先、妻子和子孫，一同進入你所應許他們的永久的樂園。你確是萬能的，確是至睿的。
null.verse 40:9: 求你使他們得免於刑罰。在那日，你使誰得免於刑罰，你已慈憫了誰，那確是偉大的成功。」
null.verse 40:10: 不信道者，必定要被召喚說：「真主痛恨你們，甚於你們痛恨自身，因為你們曾被召至正信，但你們不信。」
null.verse 40:11: 他們要說：「我們的主啊！你使我們死兩次，你使我們生兩次，故我們承認我們的罪過了。還能有一條出路嗎？」
null.verse 40:12: 這是因為祈禱真主的時候，你們否認了他的獨一；如果以物配他，你們就承認那是合理的，故判決只歸真主——至尊至大的主。
null.verse 40:13: 他把他的蹟象昭示你們，他為你們從雲中降下給養；只有歸依者能覺悟。
null.verse 40:14: 你們當祈禱真主，誠心順服他，即使不信道者不願意。
null.verse 40:15: 他是至尊的，是有寶座的，他依自己的決定發出的啟示，授予他所意欲的僕人，以便他警告眾人以相會之日——
null.verse 40:16: 他們將出現之日，他們的事，對真主毫無隱匿。「今日國權是誰的？」「是獨一至尊的真主的。」
null.verse 40:17: 今日，人人都為自己所做的而受報酬。今日，毫無虧枉，真主確是稽核神速的。
null.verse 40:18: 你應當以臨近之日警告他們，那時他們的心將升到咽喉，他滿腹憂愁。不義者，將沒有任何親友，也沒有奏效的說情者。
null.verse 40:19: 他知道偷眼和心事。
null.verse 40:20: 真主本真理而裁判。他們捨他而崇拜的，不奉任何物而裁判。真主確是全聰的，確是全明的。
null.verse 40:21: 道他們沒有在大地上旅行以觀察前人的結局是怎樣的嗎？前人比他們勢力更大、成績更多；但真主因他們的罪過而懲治了他們，他們對真主沒有任何保衛者。
null.verse 40:22: 那是因為我的眾使者曾帶著許多明証來臨他們，但他們不歸信，故真主懲罰了他們。他確是至剛的。他的刑罰確是嚴厲的，
null.verse 40:23: 我確已派遣穆薩帶著我的蹟象和明証，
null.verse 40:24: 去教化法老、哈曼和戈倫，但他們說：「他是謬妄的術士。」
null.verse 40:25: 他把從我這裡發出的真理昭示他們的時候，他們說：「你們當殺戮與他一同信道者的兒子，只留下他們的女兒。」不信道者的計策，只在迷誤中。
null.verse 40:26: 法老說：「你們讓我殺死穆薩！叫他祈禱他的主去吧！我的確怕他改變你們的宗教，或在國內作亂。」
null.verse 40:27: 穆薩說：「我確已求庇於我的主，亦即你們的主，免遭不信清算日的一切自大者的侵害。」
null.verse 40:28: 法老族中一個秘密歸信的信士說：「一個人把從你們的主發出的明証昭示你們，並說『我的主是真主』，你們就要殺戮他嗎？如果他是一個說謊者，那末，他自受謊言之害；如果他是一個誠實者，那末，他所用以恫嚇你們的災難，將有一部分來臨你們，真主必定不引導過份的常說謊言者。
null.verse 40:29: 我的宗族啊！今日國權只歸你們，你們在國中稱雄。如果真主的刑罰來臨，那末，誰助我們抵抗它呢？」法老說：「我只以我的主張指示你們，我只引導你們走上正道。」
null.verse 40:30: 信道者說：「我的宗族啊！我的確怕你們遭遇前人所遭遇的災難，
null.verse 40:31: 如努哈的宗族、阿德人、賽莫德人，以及在他們之後的人所遭受的災禍一樣。真主是不欲虧枉眾僕的。
null.verse 40:32: 我的宗族啊！我的確為你們擔心互相呼叫之日；
null.verse 40:33: 在那日，你們將轉身退後，而沒有任何保護者能使你們不受真主的懲罰。真主使誰迷誤，誰沒有向導。
null.verse 40:34: 以前優素福確已將許多明証昭示你們，但你們對他所昭示你們的明証，依然在疑惑中，直到他死去的時候，你們還說：『在他之後，真主絕不會再派遣任何使者了。』真主這樣使過份的懷疑者迷誤。」
null.verse 40:35: 沒有真憑實據，而爭論真主的蹟象者，據真主和眾信士看來，是很討厭的。真主這樣封閉一切自大的高傲者的心。
null.verse 40:36: 法老說：「哈曼啊！你為我建造一座高樓，或許我能找到若干線索——
null.verse 40:37: 天上的線索，因而能窺見穆薩的神靈；我確信他是一個說謊者。」法老的惡行，這樣迷惑了他自己，妨礙了他走上正道。法老的計策，只歸於毀滅。
null.verse 40:38: 那個歸信者又說：「我的宗族啊！你們順從我，我就把你們引上正道。
null.verse 40:39: 我的宗族啊！今世的生活，只是一種享受，後世才是安宅。
null.verse 40:40: 作惡者只受同樣的惡報；行善而且信道的男子或女子，將入樂園，受無量的供給。
null.verse 40:41: 我的宗族啊！怎麼我召你們於得渡，而你們卻召我於火獄呢？
null.verse 40:42: 你們教我不要信真主，而以我所不知的事物配他；我卻要教你們崇拜萬能的至赦的主。
null.verse 40:43: 其實，你們召我去崇拜的東西，在今世和後世，都不能應答任何祈禱。我們的歸宿是真主，過份者必是火獄的居民。
null.verse 40:44: 你們將來會想起我對你們說的話。我把我的事情委托真主，真主確是明察眾僕的。」
null.verse 40:45: 真主保護他免遭他們所計謀的禍害，並以嚴刑降於法老的宗族；
null.verse 40:46: 他們朝夕受火刑。復活時來臨之日，或者將說：「你們讓法老的宗族進去受最嚴厲的刑罰吧！」
null.verse 40:47: 那時他們在火獄中互相爭論，懦弱者對自大者說：「我們確已做過你們的順從者，你們能替我們解除一部分火刑嗎？」
null.verse 40:48: 自大者說：「我們大家的確都在火獄中，真主確已替眾僕判決了。」
null.verse 40:49: 在火獄裡的人對管理火獄的天神說：「請你們祈禱你們的主，求他給我們減輕一日的刑罰。」
null.verse 40:50: 他們說：「難道你們族中的使者，沒有昭示你們若干明証嗎？」他們說：「不然！」天神們說：「你們祈禱吧！但不信道者的祈禱只在迷誤中。」
null.verse 40:51: 我必定援助我的眾使者和眾信士，在今世生活中，和在眾見証起立之日——
null.verse 40:52: 不義者的托辭無裨於他們之日，他們將遭棄絕，他們將受後世的刑罰。
null.verse 40:53: 我確已將正道賜予穆薩，我確已使以色列的後裔繼承天經，
null.verse 40:54: 用作有心靈的向導和教誨。
null.verse 40:55: 故你當堅忍，真主的應許，確是真實的。你應當為你的過失而求饒，你應當朝夕讚頌你的主。
null.verse 40:56: 沒有真憑實據而爭論真主的蹟象者，他們的胸中，的確只有一個念頭，就是要想達到他們絕不能達到的偉大。故你當求庇於真主，他確是全聰的，確是全明的。
null.verse 40:57: 創造天地，是比再造人類更難的，但世人大半不知道。
null.verse 40:58: 無眼者與有眼者是不相等的；信道而且行善者與作惡者也是不相等的，但你們很少覺悟。
null.verse 40:59: 復活時必定來臨，這是毫無疑義的；但眾人大半不信。
null.verse 40:60: 你們的主說：「你們要祈禱我，我就應答你們；不肯崇拜我的人，他們將卑賤地入火獄。」
null.verse 40:61: 真主為你們創造黑夜，以便你們安息；創造白晝，以便你們觀看；真主對於人類，確是有恩惠的，但人類大半不感謝。
null.verse 40:62: 那是真主，是你們的主，是萬物的創造者；除他外，絕無應受崇拜的。你們怎麼如此悖謬呢？
null.verse 40:63: 否認真主的蹟象者，就是這樣悖謬的。
null.verse 40:64: 真主為你們以地面為居處，以天空為房屋，他以形象賦予你們，而使你們的形象優美，他供給你們佳美的食品。那是真主，你們的主。多福哉真主！——全世界的主！
null.verse 40:65: 他確是永生的，除他外，絕無應受祟拜的，故你們當祈禱他，誠心順服他。一切讚頌，全歸真主——全世界的主！
null.verse 40:66: 你說：「當許多明証從我的主來臨我的時候，我確已奉到禁令，不准我崇拜你們捨真主而崇拜的；我確已奉到命令，叫我順服全世界的主。」
null.verse 40:67: 他創造了你們，先用泥土，繼用精液，繼用血塊，然後使你們出生為嬰兒，然後讓你們成年，然後讓你們變成老人——你們中有夭折的——然後，讓你們活到一個定期，以便你們明理。
null.verse 40:68: 他能使人生，能使人死。當他判決一件事的時候，他只對那件事說「有」，它就有了。
null.verse 40:69: 你未見爭論真主的蹟象者怎樣悖謬嗎？
null.verse 40:70: 他們否認天經，否認我降示眾使者的蹟象，他們不久會知道（後果的）。
null.verse 40:71: 那時，鐵圈和鐵鏈，將在他們的頸上，
null.verse 40:72: 他們將被拖入沸水中，然後他們將在火中被燒的。
null.verse 40:73: 然後將有天神對他們說：「你們捨真主而崇拜的（偶像）在那裡呢？」
null.verse 40:74: 他們將說：「他們已迴避我們了。其實，以前我們並未祈禱任何物。」真主這樣使不信道者迷誤。
null.verse 40:75: 那是因為你們在地方上不該歡喜而歡喜，也是因為你們太得意了。
null.verse 40:76: 你們入火獄門而永居其中吧！自大者的住處真惡劣！
null.verse 40:77: 你當堅忍，真主的應許確是真實的。如果我要昭示你一點我用以恫嚇他們的刑罰，（那末，我對他們確是全能的）；設或我使你去世，那末，他們只被召歸於我。
null.verse 40:78: 在你之前，我確已派遣許多使者，他們中有我已告訴你的，有我未告訴你的。任何使者，不應昭示蹟象，除非獲得真主的許可。當真主的命令來臨的時候，眾生將依真理而被判決；那時，反對真理的人將遭虧折。
null.verse 40:79: 真主為你們創造了牲畜，以便你們騎乘，並食用牠們的肉，
null.verse 40:80: 你們由牠們獲得許多利益，以便你們騎著牠們，去尋求你們胸中的需要，你們用牠們和船舶載運貨物。
null.verse 40:81: 他昭示你們他的蹟象。你們否認真主的甚麼蹟象呢？
null.verse 40:82: 難道他們沒有在大地上旅行，因而觀察前人的結局是怎樣的嗎？前人比他們勢力更大，成績更多；但前人所獲得的，對於自己並沒有甚麼裨益。
null.verse 40:83: 當他們族中的眾使者昭示他們許多明証的時候，他們因自己所有的學問而洋洋得意，他們所嘲笑的刑罰，遂降臨他們。
null.verse 40:84: 當他們看見我的刑罰的時候，他們說：「我們只信真主，不信我們所用以配他的。」
null.verse 40:85: 當他們看見我的刑罰的時候，他們的正信，對他們毫無裨益。真主以此為眾僕的已逝去的常道。那時，不信道者，遭受虧折。

null.verse 40:2: Zjevení Písma pochází od Boha mocného, vševědoucího,
null.verse 40:3: viny odpouštějícího, pokání přijímajícího a v trestu strašného i shovívavosti plného. Není božstva kromě Něho a u Něho je cíl cesty konečný.
null.verse 40:4: A hádají se o znamení Boží jenom ti, kdož nevěří; nechť tě tedy neoklame volné jejich chození po této zemi!
null.verse 40:5: Již před nimi prohlašovali lidé Noema za lháře a po nich i spojenci. A každý národ usiloval zmocnit se posla svého a vystupovali proti němu lží, aby pomocí jí pravdu zničili. Však uchvátil jsem je, a jaký byl trest Můj?!
null.verse 40:6: A takto se uskutečnilo slovo Pána tvého nad těmi, kdož neuvěřili a ti budou ohně pekelného obyvateli!
null.verse 40:7: Ti andělé, kteří trůn nesou, a ti, kteří okolo stojí, chválou Pána svého slaví, v Něj věří a za odpuštění pro ty, kdož uvěřili, prosí: "Pane náš, Ty objímáš v milosrdenství i vědění Svém věc každou. Odpusť těm, kdož pokání činili a Tvou cestu následovali, a ušetři je trestu plamene pekelného
null.verse 40:8: a uveď je, Pane náš, do zahrad Edenu, které jsi jim přislíbil, a také ty z otců, manželek a potomstva jejich, kteří ctnostní byli; vždyť Tys věru mocný i moudrý.
null.verse 40:9: A zbav je zlého! A koho zbavíš v ten den zlého, tomu jsi milost Svou uštědřil a to úspěch je nesmírný."
null.verse 40:10: A bude zvoláno na ty, kdož nevěřili: "Odpor Boží je věru silnější než vaše nenávist vůči vám samým, když jsouce k víře vyzváni, přece jste neuvěřili!"
null.verse 40:11: A odvětí: "Pane náš, dals nám dvakrát zemřít a oživils nás také dvakrát a my viny své uznáváme. Je prostředek nějaký, abychom se ven z toho dostali?"
null.verse 40:12: A toto je trest za to, že když vyzýváno bylo k víře v Boha jediného, vy jste neuvěřili, však když k Němu byli jiní přidružováni, věřili jste. Rozsudek pak náleží Bohu vznešenému, velikému!
null.verse 40:13: On je ten, jenž ukazuje vám Svá znamení a sesílá vám z nebe obživu; však vzpomene si na to pouze ten, kdo pokání činí.
null.verse 40:14: Modlete se tedy k Bohu, jen Jemu zasvěcujíce víru upřímnou, i když se to nevěřícím nelibí.
null.verse 40:15: On povýšen je hodností, vládce trůnu - On posílá ducha zjevení Svého tomu, komu chce ze služebníků Svých, aby varoval přede dnem setkání,
null.verse 40:16: dnem, kdy mrtví se vynoří a kdy o nich nebude skryto před Bohem nic. "Komu dnes náleží moc královská?" "Bohu jedinému, podmaniteli!
null.verse 40:17: Dnes bude odměněna duše každá za to, co si vysloužila, a dnes nebude křivdy žádné. A Bůh rychlý je v účtování!"
null.verse 40:18: Varuj je přede dnem, jenž blízko již stojí, kdy srdce budou v hrdlech úzkostí a promluvit nebudou schopni. Nespravedliví nebudou mít přítele vřelého ani přímluvce, jemuž sluchu by bylo popřáno.
null.verse 40:19: Bůh dobře zná proradnost očí i vše, co v hrudích je skryto.
null.verse 40:20: Bůh rozhoduje podle pravdy, zatímco ti, které vedle Boha vzývají, nerozhodují podle ničeho. A Bůh věru je slyšící i jasnozřivý.
null.verse 40:21: Což necestovali po zemi, že neviděli, jaký byl konec těch, kdož před nimi byli! A přece byli silnější než oni mocí i stopami, jež na zemi zanechali. Však uchvátil je Bůh za viny jejich a neměli proti Bohu ochránce žádného.
null.verse 40:22: A toto je trest za to, že když k nim přišli poslové jejich s jasnými důkazy, neuvěřili. A uchvátil je Bůh a On věru silný je i strašný v trestání.
null.verse 40:23: A vyslali jsme již dříve Mojžíše se znameními svými a se zjevnou pravomocí
null.verse 40:24: k Faraónovi, Hámánovi a Qárúnovi, ti však řekli: "To kouzelník je prolhaný!"
null.verse 40:25: A když k nim přišel s pravdou od Nás seslanou, tu zvolali: "Zabte syny těch, kdož s ním uvěřili, a nechte jen ženy jejich naživu." Avšak úklady nevěřících jsou odsouzeny k bloudění.
null.verse 40:26: I pravil Faraón: "Nechte mne zabít Mojžíše! Ať si pak volá Pána svého! Obávám se, že změní vaše náboženství či způsobí v zemi pohoršení."
null.verse 40:27: Pravil Mojžíš: "Utíkám se o pomoc k Pánu svému i Pánu vašemu před každým pyšným, jenž nevěří v den zúčtování!"
null.verse 40:28: I pravil nějaký muž věřící z rodu Faraónova, jenž skrýval víru svou: "Což chcete zabít člověka jen proto, že říká: Pánem mým je Bůh? Vždyť přišel k vám s jasnými důkazy od Pána vašeho; je-li lhářem, tedy lež jeho se proti němu obrátí, však hovoří-li pravdu, budete postiženi částí toho, čím vám hrozí. Vždyť Bůh nevede správnou cestou toho, kdo přestupníkem je a lhářem.
null.verse 40:29: Lide můj! Dnes náleží vám panství a máte nadvládu v zemi této, však kdo nám pomůže proti přísnosti Boží, jestliže na nás padne?" Faraón však odvětil: "Já ukazuji vám jen to, co sám vidím, a jedině já vás vedu cestou správnou."
null.verse 40:30: Ten, jenž byl věřící, zvolal: "Lide můj! Bojím se, že na vás přijde den podobný dni spojenců
null.verse 40:31: a osud podobný tomu, jenž postihl lid Noemův, ´Ádovce i Thamúdovce a ty, kdož byli po nich. Bůh přece nechce, aby se dála křivda služebníkům Jeho.
null.verse 40:32: Lide můj! Obávám se pro vás dne vzájemného volání,
null.verse 40:33: dne, kdy se obrátíte zády nemajíce proti Bohu ochránce žádného, neboť ten, komu Bůh dal zbloudit, nemá žádného vedoucího.
null.verse 40:34: A přišel k vám již dříve Josef s jasnými důkazy, a nepřestali jste pochybovat o tom, co vám přinesl. A když zahynul, řekli jste: "Bůh po něm už nevyšle posla žádného." A takto Bůh dává zbloudit tomu, kdo přestupníkem je a pochybovačem.
null.verse 40:35: To jsou ti, kdož se hádají ohledně znamení Božích, aniž se jim k tomu dostalo oprávnění. Veliký je vůči nim odpor u Boha i těch, kdož uvěřili. A takto Bůh zapečeťuje srdce každého pyšného a úporně vzdorujícího."
null.verse 40:36: Faraón pak pravil: "Hámáne, postav pro mne věž, snad dosáhnu provazů,
null.verse 40:37: provazů nebeských, a vystoupím až k božstvu Mojžíšovu, neboť jej za lháře považují." A takto byla pro Faraóna okrášlena špatnost jeho skutků, byl sveden z cesty a úklad jeho skončil jedině záhubou.
null.verse 40:38: Pravil pak ten, jenž uvěřil: "Lide můj! Následujte mne a já povedu vás cestou správnou!
null.verse 40:39: Lide můj! Tento pozemský život není nic než dočasné užívání, zatímco život budoucí bude příbytkem stálým.
null.verse 40:40: Kdokoliv koná špatné, ten odměněn bude něčím podobným, ale kdokoliv koná dobré - ať muž je či žena - a je věřící, ten do ráje vstoupí, kde obdařen bude darem nepočítaným.
null.verse 40:41: Lide můj! Proč vás vlastně vyzývám ke spáse, když vy mne zvete k ohni pekelnému?
null.verse 40:42: Vyzýváte mne, abych nevěřil v Boha a k Němu přidružoval to, o čem nemám žádné vědomosti, zatímco já vás vyzývám k mocnému, odpouštějícímu.
null.verse 40:43: Není pochyby, že to, k čemu mne zvete, nemá být vzýváno ani na tomto, ani na onom světě a že návrat náš se jedině k Bohu uskuteční, zatímco přestupníci se stanou pekla obyvateli.
null.verse 40:44: A jednou si vzpomenete na to, co vám říkám; já pak předávám svou věc Bohu, neboť Bůh jasně sleduje služebníky Své!"
null.verse 40:45: Bůh jej ochránil od zlého, které mu úkladně chystali, zatímco rod Faraónův obklopil trestem nejhorším,
null.verse 40:46: ohněm, jemuž budou vystaveni za jitra i za večera. A v den, kdy udeří Hodina, bude zvoláno: "Uveďte rod Faraónův do trestu nejpřísnějšího!"
null.verse 40:47: A hle, budou se navzájem hádat v ohni a řeknou slabí těm, kdož pyšní byli: "My jsme vás následovali, můžete nás zbavit části ohně tohoto?"
null.verse 40:48: A řeknou ti, kdož pyšní byli: "My v ohni jsme nyní všichni a věru Bůh již mezi služebníky Svými rozsoudil."
null.verse 40:49: A ti, kdož budou v ohni, řeknou strážcům pekla: "Poproste Pána svého, aby alespoň jeden den z trestu našeho nám slevil!"
null.verse 40:50: A zeptají se strážci: "Cožpak k vám nepřišli vaši poslové s jasnými důkazy?" Odpovědí: "Ano." A řeknou strážci: "Tak si proste sami!" A prosba nevěřících není leč bloudění.
null.verse 40:51: My zajisté pomůžeme poslům svým i těm, kdož uvěřili, v životě pozemském i v den, kdy vstanou svědkové,
null.verse 40:52: v den, kdy nebudou nic platny nespravedlivým výmluvy jejich, nýbrž padne na ně prokletí a údělem jich bude příbytek nejhorší.
null.verse 40:53: A již kdysi jsme dali Mojžíšovi správné vedení a učinili jsme dítka Izraele dědici Písma,
null.verse 40:54: aby bylo vedením a připomenutím pro lidi nadané rozumem.
null.verse 40:55: Buď tedy trpělivý, neboť slib Boží je pravdivý! A pros za odpuštění hříchů svých a oslavuj chválou Pána svého za večera i za jitra!
null.verse 40:56: Ti, kdož se hádají kvůli znamením Božím, aniž se jim k tomu dostalo oprávnění, v srdcích svých pouze domýšlivost mají a cíle svého nedosáhnou. Obrať se o pomoc k Bohu, vždyť On věru slyšící je i jasnozřivý!
null.verse 40:57: Stvoření nebes a země zajisté je velkolepější než stvoření lidí, avšak většina lidí nemá o tom ponětí.
null.verse 40:58: Slepý s vidoucím si nejsou rovni a nejsou si rovni ti, kdož věří a zbožné skutky konají, s těmi, kdož zlo páchají - a jak málo jste pamětliví!
null.verse 40:59: Hodina se vskutku dostaví, o tom pochyby není, avšak většina lidí tomu nevěří.
null.verse 40:60: I pravil Pán váš: "Vzývejte Mne a Já vás vyslyším! Ti, kdo se pyšně povyšují nad uctívání, ti věru vejdou do pekla, kde budou poníženi."
null.verse 40:61: Bůh je ten, jenž pro vás učinil noc, abyste v ní odpočívali, a den, abyste v něm jasně viděli. A věru je Bůh vůči lidem pln dobrodiní, avšak mnozí nejsou za to vděční.
null.verse 40:62: Takový je Bůh, váš Pán, stvořitel věci každé; není božstva kromě Něho! Jak se jen můžete odvracet od Něho?
null.verse 40:63: Takto se od Něho odvraceli již ti, kdož znamení Boží popírali.
null.verse 40:64: Bůh je ten, jenž pro vás zemi příbytkem stálým učinil a nebesa nad vámi budovou; on vyrovnal vás a podobu krásnou vám dal a pokrmy výtečné vám uštědřil. Takový je Bůh, váš Pán! Požehnán buď Bůh, Pán lidstva veškerého.
null.verse 40:65: On živý je a není božstva kromě Něho! Modlete se k Němu zasvěcujíce Mu upřímnou víru svou! Chvála Bohu, Pánu lidstva veškerého!
null.verse 40:66: Rci: "Bylo mi zakázáno, abych uctíval ty, jež vzýváte vedle Boha, když se mi dostalo jasných důkazů od Pána mého. A bylo mi poručeno, abych se odevzdal do vůle Pána lidstva veškerého."
null.verse 40:67: On je ten, který vás stvořil z prachu, potom z kapky semene, pak z kapky přilnavé, potom vás vyvedl jako kojence, abyste později dosáhli dospělosti a abyste se posléze stali starci a někteří z vás budou povoláni k Němu dříve a abyste dospěli ke lhůtě stanovené, snad rozumní budete.
null.verse 40:68: On je ten, kdo oživuje i usmrcuje, a když o něčem rozhodne, tu řekne pouze: "Staniž se!" a stane se.
null.verse 40:69: Což jsi neviděl, kam se dostali ti, kdož se hádali ohledně Božích znamení?
null.verse 40:70: Ti, kdož prohlašovali Písmo i to, s čím posly Své jsme vyslali, za lež, ti záhy poznají,
null.verse 40:71: až s okovy na šíjích a v řetězech budou vláčeni
null.verse 40:72: do vody vroucí a pak v pekle budou páleni!
null.verse 40:73: A potom budou dotázáni: "Kde jsou tedy ti, které jste přidružovali
null.verse 40:74: k Bohu?" I odvětí: "Ztratili se nám. Ale my vlastně jsme dříve nevzývali nic." A takto Bůh dává zbloudit nevěřícím.
null.verse 40:75: Tohle je trest za to, že jste se na zemi neoprávněně radovali, i za to, že jste byli zpupní.
null.verse 40:76: Vejděte do bran pekelných, kde zůstanete nesmrtelní! Jak hnusné bude hrdopyšných přebývání!"
null.verse 40:77: Buď trpělivý, neboť slib Boží je pravdivý! A ať ti již ukážeme část z toho, co jsme jim slíbili, anebo tě k Sobě povoláme dříve - k Nám budou všichni navráceni.
null.verse 40:78: Již před tebou jsme posly vysílali; o některých z nich jsme ti vyprávěli a o jiných jsme ti nevyprávěli. A nebylo dáno poslu žádnému, aby přinesl znamení, leč s dovolením Božím. A až se dostaví rozkaz Boží, bude rozsouzeno podle pravdy a tehdy budou ztraceni ti, kdož za nicotné to měli.
null.verse 40:79: Bůh je ten, jenž pro vás stvořil velbloudy, abyste na nich jezdili a jimi se též živili
null.verse 40:80: a mnohý užitek jiný z nich měli a abyste pomocí jich splnění úmyslů hrudí svých dosáhli. A na nich stejně jako na lodích jste neseni.
null.verse 40:81: Tak ukazuje vám Bůh Svá znamení. A která ze znamení Božích chcete popírat?
null.verse 40:82: Což po zemi necestovali, že neviděli, jaký byl konec těch, kdož před nimi byli a kteří byli početnější a mocnější silou i stopami, jež na zemi zanechali! A nebylo jim k ničemu to, čeho nabyli.
null.verse 40:83: Když k nim poslové jejich přišli s jasnými důkazy, holedbali se nevěřící tím, co bylo u nich z vědění, však obklopilo je to, čemu se posmívali.
null.verse 40:84: A když spatřili přísnost Naši, zvolali: "Uvěřili jsme v Boha i v jedinost Jeho a přestali jsme věřit v to, co jsme k Němu dříve přidružovali."
null.verse 40:85: Však neprospěla jim pozdní víra jejich poté, co přísnost Naši spatřili, v souladu se zvyklostí Boží, kterou on vůči služebníkům Svým vždy dodrží. A tehdy nevěřící ztrátu utrpí!

null.verse 40:2: De openbaring van dit Boek is van God, de Almachtige, de Alwetende.
null.verse 40:3: De Vergever der zonden, de Aanvaarder van berouw, de Gestrenge in het straffen, de Heer van genade. Er is geen God buiten Hem. Tot Hem is de terugkeer.
null.verse 40:4: Niemand betwist de woorden van God behalve de ongelovigen. Laat hun bedrijvigheid in het land u niet bedriegen.
null.verse 40:5: Het volk van Noach voor hen en andere groepen na hen verloochenden ook en elk volk besloot zijn boodschapper te vangen en twistte door leugen om de Waarheid er mee te niet te doen. Dan greep Ik hen en hoe verschrikkelijk was Mijn straf!
null.verse 40:6: Zo werd het woord van uw Heer bewaarheid ten opzichte van de ongelovigen: dat zij de bewoners van het Vuur zouden zijn.
null.verse 40:7: Zij, die de Troon dragen en zij die er omheen staan verheerlijken hun Heer met de lof die Hem toekomt en zij geloven in Hem en vragen vergiffenis voor de gelovigen, zeggende: "Onze Heer, Gij omvat alle dingen in Uw barmhartigheid en kennis. Vergeef daarom hen die berouw tonen en Uw weg volgen; en behoed hen voor de straf der hel,
null.verse 40:8: Onze Heer, en doe hen de tuinen der Eeuwigheid ingaan, die Gij hun hebt beloofd, alsook de deugdzamen onder hun ouders, hun echtgenoten en hun kinderen. Zeker, Gij zijt de Almachtige, de Alwijze.
null.verse 40:9: "En behoed hen voor het kwade; en een ieder die Gij op die Dag voor het kwade behoedt, hem betoont Gij zeker barmhartigheid. En dat is de grootste zegepraal."
null.verse 40:10: De ongelovigen zullen worden toegesproken: "Het misnoegen van God was groter dan uw eigen misnoegen toen gij tot het geloof werd geroepen doch gij dit verwierpt."
null.verse 40:11: Zij zullen zeggen: "Onze Heer, Gij deedt ons tweemaal sterven en Gij hebt ons tweemaal in het leven teruggeroepen en wij bekennen onze zonden. Is er nu een uitweg?"
null.verse 40:12: Dit kwam omdat gij niet geloofdet toen God de Ene werd genoemd, maar toen Hem medegoden werden toegeschreven, geloofdet gij. Nu behoort het oordeel aan God, de Allerhoogste, de
null.verse 40:13: Hij is het Die u Zijn tekenen toont en voorziening voor u van de hemel nederzendt; maar niemand trekt er lering uit behalve hij die zich (tot God) wendt.
null.verse 40:14: Roept alleen God aan, oprecht zijnde in gehoorzaamheid tot Hem, hoewel de ongelovigen er tegen zijn.
null.verse 40:15: Verheven boven alle graden is de Heer van de Troon. Hij zendt het woord door Zijn gebod aan wie Hij wil van Zijn dienaren, opdat hij moge waarschuwen voor de Dag der Ontmoeting.
null.verse 40:16: De Dag waarop zij naar voren zullen komen - zal niets van hen voor God verborgen zijn. "Van Wie is het Koninkrijk op deze Dag?" "Van God, de Ene, de Onweerstaanbare."
null.verse 40:17: "Op deze Dag zal elke ziel worden beloond voor hetgeen zij heeft verdiend. Geen onrecht zal geschieden op deze Dag. Voorzeker, God is snel in het beoordelen."
null.verse 40:18: Waarschuw hen voor de naderende Dag, wanneer het hart in de keel klopt terwijl zij vol verdriet zullen zijn. De onrechtvaardigen zullen geen boezemvrienden hebben, noch enige bemiddelaar naar wie zal worden geluisterd.
null.verse 40:19: Hij kent de oneerlijkheid der ogen en datgene wat de harten verbergen.
null.verse 40:20: En God richt naar waarheid, maar degenen die zij aanroepen naast Hem kunnen in het geheel niet richten. Voorzeker, God is de Alhorende, de Alziende.
null.verse 40:21: Hebben zij niet over de aarde gereisd en gezien wat het einde was van hen die vóór hen waren? Zij waren machtiger dan dezen in kracht en in hun sporen op aarde. Toch greep God hen voor hun zonden en zij hadden niemand om hen tegen God te beschermen.
null.verse 40:22: Dat kwam omdat hun boodschappers tot hen kwamen met duidelijke tekenen, doch zij verwierpen ze; daarom greep God hen. Voorzeker, Hij is Machtig, Streng in het straffen.
null.verse 40:23: En Wij zonden Mozes met Onze tekenen en een duidelijk gezag,
null.verse 40:24: Tot Pharao en Hamaan en Korach, maar zij zeiden: "Hij is een tovenaar en de grootste leugenaar."
null.verse 40:25: En toen hij (Mozes) met Waarheid van Ons tot hen kwam, zeiden zij: "Doodt de zonen der gelovigen met hem en ontziet hun vrouwen." Maar het plan der ongelovigen is ijdel.
null.verse 40:26: En Pharao zeide: "Laat mij Mozes doodslaan en laat hem dan zijn Heer aanroepen. Ik vrees dat hij uw godsdienst zal veranderen of in het land onrust zal stoken."
null.verse 40:27: En Mozes zeide: "Ik zoek toevlucht bij mijn Heer en uw Heer, tegen elke laatdunkende die aan de Dag des Oordeels niet gelooft."
null.verse 40:28: En een gelovig man uit het volk van Pharao die zijn geloof verborg, zeide: "Wilt gij een man doden omdat hij zegt: ’Mijn Heer is God’; terwijl hij tot u gekomen is met duidelijke tekenen van uw Heer? Is hij een leugenaar, dan rust zijn leugen op hem; maar als hij oprecht is, dan zal iets van datgene, waarmee hij u bedreigt, u overkomen. Voorzeker, God leidt hem die buitensporig en een grote leugenaar is, niet.
null.verse 40:29: O mijn volk heden hebt gij de oppermacht en gij zijt de hoogsten in het land. Maar wie zal ons beschermen tegen de straf van God als zij over ons komt?" Pharao zeide: "Ik wijs u alleen dat aan wat ik zelf zie en ik leid u slechts naar het pad der rechtschapenheid."
null.verse 40:30: En de gelovige zeide: "O mijn volk, ik vrees voor u een gebeurtenis zoals op de Dag der bondgenoten,
null.verse 40:31: Zoals hoe geval was bij het volk van Noach, en Aad en Samoed en degenen die na hen waren. God wil Zijn dienaren geen onrecht aandoen.
null.verse 40:32: En o mijn volk, ik vrees voor u de Dag van het geweeklaag.
null.verse 40:33: Een Dag waarop gij u zult afwenden om te vluchten. Dan zult gij geen beschermer hebben tegen God. En hij die God laat dwalen zal geen leider hebben.
null.verse 40:34: En voordien kwam Jozef tot u met duidelijke tekenen, maar gij bleeft twijfeles aan hetgeen hij u bracht doch toen hij stierf zeidet gjj: "God zal na hem geen boodschapper meer zenden." Alzo laat God de buitensporigen en de twijfelaars dwalen.
null.verse 40:35: Degenen die twisten over de tekenen van God zonder dat enig gezag (daarover) tot hen kwam; dit is afkeurenswaardig in de ogen van God en de gelovigen. Alzo verzegelt God het hart van iedere hoogmoedige en onderdrukker.
null.verse 40:36: En Pharao zeide: "O Hamaan, bouw mij een toren opdat ik de toegangswegen moge naderen,
null.verse 40:37: De toegangswegen der hemelen, opdat ik de God van Mozes moge bereiken ofschoon ik zeker weet dat hij een leugenaar is." Zo werd voor Pharao zijn slechte daad schoonschijnend gemaakt, hij werd van het rechte pad afgeleid en Pharao’s plan eindigde slechts in ondergang.
null.verse 40:38: En de gelovige zeide: "O, mijn volk, volg mij, ik zal u op het pad van leiding voeren.
null.verse 40:39: O mijn volk, dit leven dezer wereld is slechts een voorbijgaand genoegen; en het Hiernamaals is het blijvende tehuis.
null.verse 40:40: Wie kwaad doet zal naar evenredigheid hiervan worden vergolden; maar wie goed doet, man of vrouw, en gelovig is zal het paradijs binnengaan; daarin zullen zij van alles worden voorzien, zonder berekening.
null.verse 40:41: En O mijn volk, hoe komt het toch dat ik u tot redding roep en gij mij tot het Vuur wilt leiden?
null.verse 40:42: Gij nodigt mij uit, God te verwerpen en iets met Hem te vereenzelvigen waarvan ik geen kennis heb. En ik roep u tot de Almachtige, de Vergevensgezinde."
null.verse 40:43: "Zeker, datgene waartoe gij mij uitnodigt heeft geen macht in deze wereld of in het Hiernamaals; voorwaar, onze terugkeer is tot God, en de overtreders zullen de bewoners van het Vuur zijn.
null.verse 40:44: Weldra zult gij u herinneren wat ik u zeg. En ik vertrouw mijn zaak aan God toe. Voorwaar, God ziet Zijn dienaren door en door."
null.verse 40:45: Daarom beschermde God hem voor het kwade hunner plannen, en een zware straf kwam over het volk van Pharao;
null.verse 40:46: Aan het Vuur zullen zij morgen en avond worden blootgesteld. En de Dag waarop het Uur zal komen, zal er worden gezegd: "Doet Pharao’s volk de strengste straf ondergaan."
null.verse 40:47: En wanneer zij met elkander in het Vuur zullen twisten, zullen de zwakken tot de trotsen zeggen: "Voorzeker, wij waren uw volgelingen; wilt gij dan nu een gedeelte van het Vuur van ons wegnemen?"
null.verse 40:48: Zij die trots waren zullen zeggen: "Wij zijn er allen in. God heeft nu over Zijn dienaren recht gesproken."
null.verse 40:49: En degenen die in het Vuur zijn zullen tot de bewaarders der hel zeggen: "Bidt uw Heer, een dag van onze straf te verlichten."
null.verse 40:50: Zij zullen antwoorden: "Kwamen uw boodschappers niet tot u met duidelijke bewijzen?" Zij zullen zeggen: "Ja zeker." De bewaarders zullen antwoorden: "Bidt dan." Maar het bidden der ongelovigen is nutteloos.
null.verse 40:51: Voorwaar, Wij helpen Onze boodschappers en de gelovigen in het leven dezer wereld en op de Dag waarop de getuigen zullen opstaan.
null.verse 40:52: De Dag, waarop de verontschuldiging van de onrechtvaardigen niets zal baten en voor hen zal de vloek en het kwade tehuis zijn.
null.verse 40:53: En Wij gaven Mozes de leiding, en deden de kinderen van Israël het Boek erven.
null.verse 40:54: Als richtsnoer en aanmaning voor mensen van begrip.
null.verse 40:55: Heb geduld, voorzeker, God’s belofte is waar. En vraag bescherming tegen uw zonde en eert uw Heer ’s morgens en ’s avonds met de lof die Hem toekomt.
null.verse 40:56: Zij die over de tekenen van God twisten zonder dat hun het gezag daartoe verleend is, hebben in hun innerlijk niets dan trots, die zij niet kunnen verwerkelijken. Zoekt daarom uw toevlucht bij God. Waarlijk, Hij is de Alhorende, de Alziende.
null.verse 40:57: Voorzeker, de schepping der hemelen en der aarde is groter dan de schepping der mensen maar de meeste mensen beseffen het niet.
null.verse 40:58: De blinden en de zienden zijn niet gelijk; noch zijn zij, die geloven en goede werken doen gelijk aan hen die kwaad doen. Gering is de lering die gij hieruit trekt.
null.verse 40:59: Het Uur zal zeker komen, daaraan is geen twifel; toch geloven de meeste men sen het niet.
null.verse 40:60: En uw Heer zegt: "Aanbidt Mij; Ik zal uw gebed verhoren. Maar zij die te hoogmoedig zijn om Mij te aanbidden, zullen veracht de hel binnengaan."
null.verse 40:61: God is Degene Die de nacht voor u aanwees opdat gij er in moogt rusten en de dag om u licht te geven. Voorwaar, God is vol genade voor de mensen, toch zijn de meeste mensen ondankbaar.
null.verse 40:62: Zo is God uw Heer, de Schepper aller dingen. Er is geen God naast Hem. Waarheen wordt gij dan afgewend?
null.verse 40:63: Zo worden degenen, die de tekenen van God verloochenen, afgeleid.
null.verse 40:64: God is het, Die de aarde voor u als een rustplaats heeft gemaakt en de hemelen als gewelf, Die u gevormd heeft en u een schone vorm heeft gegeven en u van goede dingen heeft voorzien. Dit is God uw Heer. Gezegend is God, de Heer der Werelden.
null.verse 40:65: Hij is de Levende, er is geen God naast Hem. Aanbidt daarom Hem alleen, oprecht zijnde in gehoorzaamheid tot Hem. Alle lof behoort aan God, de Heer der Werelden.
null.verse 40:66: Zeg: "Het is mij verboden diegenen te aanbidden die gij naast God aanroept daar er duidelijke bewjizen van mijn Heer tot mij zijn gekomen; en het is mij geboden mij te onderwerpen aan de Heer der Werelden."
null.verse 40:67: Hij is het Die u uit stof schiep, dan uit een levenskiem en uit een klonter bloed, vervolgens brengt Hij u voort als een kind, dan bereikt gij de volwassenheid, daarna wordt gij oud. Sommigen sterven eerder, en anderen onder u zullen een vastgestelde tijd bereiken; opdat gij tot inzicht komt.
null.verse 40:68: Hij is het Die leven geeft en doet sterven. En wanneer Hij iets besluit, zegt Hij slechts: "Wees", en het wordt.
null.verse 40:69: Hebt gij degenen niet gezien, die over de tekenen van God redetwisten? Hoe worden zij afgewend!
null.verse 40:70: Degenen die het Boek en hetgeen waarmee Wij Onze boodschappers zonden, verloochenden, zullen weldra (de waarheid) te weten komen,
null.verse 40:71: Wanneer zij met boeien en kettingen om hun hals zullen worden gesleept
null.verse 40:72: In kokend water; dan zullen zij in het vuur worden geworpen.
null.verse 40:73: Dan zal er tot hen worden gezegd: "Waar zijn (de afgoden), die gij met God hadt vereenzelvigd?"
null.verse 40:74: "Naast God?" Zij zullen zeggen: "Zij zijn verloren gegaan. Neen, wij plachten voorheen niets te aanbidden." Zo laat God de ongelovigen dwalen.
null.verse 40:75: Er zal tot hen worden gezegd: "Dit is omdat gij op aarde ten onrechte placht te jubelen en omdat gij hoovaardig waart."
null.verse 40:76: "Gaat de poorten der hel binnen daarin vertoevende. Kwaad is nu het tehuis voor de laatdunkenden."
null.verse 40:77: Heb daarom geduld, God’s belofte is zeker waar. Of Wij u de straf waarmede Wij hen bedreigen gedeeltelijk tonen of u (vóór dien) doen sterven, zij zullen toch tot Ons worden teruggebracht.
null.verse 40:78: En Wij zonden boodschappers vóór u, sommigen van hen hebben Wij vermeld en anderen hebben Wij niet genoemd en geen boodschapper kan een teken brengen zonder God’s gebod. En wanneer God’s gebod komt, wordt er in waarheid geoordeeld en dan gaan de leugenaars verloren.
null.verse 40:79: Het is God, Die u vee heeft gegeven, opdat gij op sommige dieren moogt rijden en andere als voedsel gebruiken.
null.verse 40:80: En gij hebt andere voordelen van hen - zodat gij door hen elke behoefte die in uw innerlijk is, tevreden moogt stellen. En door hen (te land) en op schepen (ter zee) wordt gij gedragen.
null.verse 40:81: En Hij toont u Zijn tekenen; welke van de tekenen van God wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 40:82: Hebben zij niet op aarde gereisd en gezien wat het einde was van degenen die voor hen waren? Zij waren groter in aantal dan dezen en machtiger in kracht, en in de sporen die zij op aarde achterlieten. Maar alles wat zij verwierven baatte hen niet.
null.verse 40:83: En toen hun boodschappers met duidelijke tekenen tot hen kwamen, namen zij genoegen met de kennis die zij bezaten. en de straf waarover zij spotten, verstrikte hen.
null.verse 40:84: En toen zij Onze straf zagen zeiden zij: "Wij geloven in God als de Enige en wij verwerpen alles wat wij vroeger met Hem plachten te vereenzelvigen."
null.verse 40:85: Maar nadat zij Onze straf hadden gezien kon hun geloof hun niet meer baten. Dit is God’s wet die haar loop neemt ten opzichte van Zijn dienaren en zo gingen de ongelovigen verloren.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:2: The revelation of the Scripture is from Allah, the Mighty, the Knower,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:3: The Forgiver of sin, the Accepter of repentance, the Stern in punishment, the Bountiful. There is no God save Him. Unto Him is the journeying.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:4: None argue concerning the revelations of Allah save those who disbelieve, so let not their turn of fortune in the land deceive thee (O Muhammad).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:5: The folk of Noah and the factions after them denied (their messengers) before these, and every nation purposed to seize their messenger and argued falsely, (thinking) thereby to refute the Truth. Then I seized them, and how (awful) was My punishment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:6: Thus was the word of thy Lord concerning those who disbelieve fulfilled: That they are owners of the Fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:7: Those who bear the Throne, and all who are round about it, hymn the praises of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who believe (saying): Our Lord! Thou comprehendest all things in mercy and knowledge, therefor forgive those who repent and follow Thy way. Ward off from them the punishment of hell.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:8: Our Lord! And make them enter the Gardens of Eden which thou hast promised them, with such of their fathers and their wives and their descendants as do right. Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Mighty, the Wise.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:9: And ward off from them ill-deeds; and he from whom Thou wardest off ill-deeds that day, him verily hast Thou taken into mercy. That is the supreme triumph.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:10: Lo! (on that day) those who disbelieve are informed by proclamation: Verily Allah’s abhorrence is more terrible than your abhorrence one of another, when ye were called unto the faith but did refuse.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:11: They say: Our Lord! Twice hast Thou made us die, and twice hast Thou made us live. Now we confess our sins. Is there any way to go out ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:12: (It is said unto them): This is (your plight) because, when Allah only was invoked, ye disbelieved, but when some partner was ascribed to Him ye were believing. But the command belongeth only to Allah, the Sublime, the Majestic.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:13: He it is Who showeth you His portents, and sendeth down for you provision from the sky. None payeth heed save him who turneth (unto Him) repentant.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:14: Therefor (O believers) pray unto Allah, making religion pure for Him (only), however much the disbelievers be averse -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:15: The Exalter of Ranks, the Lord of the Throne. He causeth the Spirit of His command upon whom He will of His slaves, that He may warn of the Day of Meeting,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:16: The day when they come forth, nothing of them being hidden from Allah. Whose is the Sovereignty this day ? It is Allah’s, the One, the Almighty.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:17: This day is each soul requited that which it hath earned; no wrong (is done) this day. Lo! Allah is swift at reckoning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:18: Warn them (O Muhammad) of the Day of the approaching (doom), when the hearts will be choking the throats, (when) there will be no friend for the wrong-doers, nor any intercessor who will be heard.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:19: He knoweth the traitor of the eyes, and that which the bosoms hide.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:20: Allah judgeth with truth, while those to whom they cry instead of Him judge not at all. Lo! Allah, He is the Hearer, the Seer.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:21: Have they not travelled in the land to see the nature of the consequence for those who disbelieved before them ? They were mightier than these in power and (in the) traces (which they left behind them) in the earth. Yet Allah seized them for their sins, and they had no protector from Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:22: That was because their messengers kept bringing them clear proofs (of Allah’s Sovereignty) but they disbelieved; so Allah seized them. Lo! He is Strong, severe in punishment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:23: And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations and a clear warrant
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:24: Unto Pharaoh and Haman and Korah, but they said: A lying sorcerer!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:25: And when he brought them the Truth from Our presence, they said: Slay the sons of those who believe with him, and spare their women. But the plot of disbelievers is in naught but error.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:26: And Pharaoh said: Suffer me to kill Moses, and let him cry unto his Lord. Lo! I fear that he will alter your religion or that he will cause confusion in the land.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:27: Moses said: Lo! I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every scorner who believeth not in a Day of Reckoning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:28: And a believing man of Pharaoh’s family, who hid his faith, said: Would ye kill a man because he saith: My Lord is Allah, and hath brought you clear proofs from your Lord ? If he is lying, then his lie is upon him; and if he is truthful, then some of that wherewith he threateneth you will strike you. Lo! Allah guideth not one who is a prodigal, a liar.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:29: O my people! Yours is the kingdom to-day, ye being uppermost in the land. But who would save us from the wrath of Allah should it reach us ? Pharaoh said: I do but show you what I think, and I do but guide you to wise policy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:30: And he who believed said: O my people! Lo! I fear for you a fate like that of the factions (of old);
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:31: A plight like that of Noah’s folk, and A’ad and Thamud, and those after them, and Allah willeth no injustice for (His) slaves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:32: And, O my people! Lo! I fear for you a Day of Summoning,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:33: A day when ye will turn to flee, having no preserver from Allah: and he whom Allah sendeth astray, for him there is no guide.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:34: And verily Joseph brought you of old clear proofs, yet ye ceased not to be in doubt concerning what he brought you till, when he died, ye said: Allah will not send any messenger after him. Thus Allah deceiveth him who is a prodigal, a doubter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:35: Those who wrangle concerning the revelations of Allah without any warrant that hath come unto them, it is greatly hateful in the sight of Allah and in the sight of those who believe. Thus doth Allah print on every arrogant, disdainful heart.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:36: And Pharaoh said: O Haman! Build for me a tower that haply I may reach the roads,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:37: The roads of the heavens, and may look upon the God of Moses, though verily I think him a liar. Thus was the evil that he did made fairseeming unto Pharaoh, and he was debarred from the (right) way. The plot of Pharaoh ended but in ruin.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:38: And he who believed said: O my people! Follow me. I will show you the way of right conduct.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:39: O my people! Lo! this life of the world is but a passing comfort, and lo! the Hereafter, that is the enduring home.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:40: Whoso doeth an ill-deed, he will be repaid the like thereof, while whoso doeth right, whether male or female, and is a believer, (all) such will enter the Garden, where they will be nourished without stint.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:41: And, O my people! What aileth me that I call you unto deliverance when ye call me unto the Fire ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:42: Ye call me to disbelieve in Allah and ascribe unto Him as partners that whereof I have no knowledge, while I call you unto the Mighty, the Forgiver.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:43: Assuredly that whereunto ye call me hath no claim in the world or in the Hereafter, and our return will be unto Allah, and the prodigals will be owners of the Fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:44: And ye will remember what I say unto you. I confide my cause unto Allah. Lo! Allah is Seer of (His) slaves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:45: So Allah warded off from him the evils which they plotted, while a dreadful doom encompassed Pharaoh’s folk,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:46: The Fire; they are exposed to it morning and evening; and on the day when the Hour upriseth (it is said): Cause Pharaoh’s folk to enter the most awful doom.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:47: And when they wrangle in the Fire, the weak say unto those who were proud: Lo! we were a following unto you; will ye therefor rid us of a portion of the Fire ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:48: Those who were proud say: Lo! we are all (together) herein. Lo! Allah hath judged between (His) slaves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:49: And those in the Fire say unto the guards of hell: Entreat your Lord that He relieve us of a day of the torment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:50: They say: Came not your messengers unto you with clear proofs ? They say: Yea, verily. They say: Then do ye pray, although the prayer of disbelievers is in vain.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:51: Lo! We verily do help Our messengers, and those who believe, in the life of the world and on the day when the witnesses arise,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:52: The day when their excuse availeth not the evil-doers, and theirs is the curse, and theirs the ill abode.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:53: And We verily gave Moses the guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:54: A guide and a reminder for men of understanding.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:55: Then have patience (O Muhammad). Lo! the promise of Allah is true. And ask forgiveness of thy sin, and hymn the praise of thy Lord at fall of night and in the early hours.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:56: Lo! those who wrangle concerning the revelations of Allah without a warrant having come unto them, there is naught else in their breasts save pride which they will never attain. So take thou refuge in Allah. Lo! He, only He, is the Hearer, the Seer.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:57: Assuredly the creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of mankind; but most of mankind know not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:58: And the blind man and the seer are not equal, neither are those who believe and do good works (equal with) the evil-doer. Little do ye reflect!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:59: Lo! the Hour is surely coming, there is no doubt thereof; yet most of mankind believe not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:60: And your Lord hath said: Pray unto Me and I will hear your prayer. Lo! those who scorn My service, they will enter hell, disgraced.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:61: Allah it is Who hath appointed for you night that ye may rest therein, and day for seeing. Lo! Allah is a Lord of bounty for mankind, yet most of mankind give not thanks.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:62: Such is Allah, your Lord, the Creator of all things, There is no God save Him. How then are ye perverted ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:63: Thus are they perverted who deny the revelations of Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:64: Allah it is Who appointed for you the earth for a dwelling-place and the sky for a canopy, and fashioned you and perfected your shapes, and hath provided you with good things. Such is Allah, your Lord. Then blessed be Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:65: He is the Living One. There is no God save Him. So pray unto Him, making religion pure for Him (only). Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:66: Say (O Muhammad): I am forbidden to worship those unto whom ye cry beside Allah since there have come unto me clear proofs from my Lord, and I am commanded to surrender to the Lord of the Worlds.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:67: He it is Who created you from dust, then from a drop (of seed) then from a clot, then bringeth you forth as a child, then (ordaineth) that ye attain full strength and afterward that ye become old men - though some among you die before - and that ye reach an appointed term, that haply ye may understand.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:68: He it is Who quickeneth and giveth death. When He ordaineth a thing, He saith unto it only: Be! and it is.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:69: Hast thou not seen those who wrangle concerning the revelations of Allah, how they are turned away ? -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:70: Those who deny the Scripture and that wherewith We send Our messengers. But they will come to know,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:71: When carcans are about their necks and chains. They are dragged
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:72: Through boiling waters; then they are thrust into the Fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:73: Then it is said unto them: Where are (all) that ye used to make partners (in the Sovereignty)
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:74: Beside Allah ? They say: They have failed us; but we used not to pray to anything before. Thus doth Allah send astray the disbelievers (in His guidance).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:75: (And it is said unto them): This is because ye exulted in the earth without right, and because ye were petulant.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:76: Enter ye the gates of hell, to dwell therein. Evil is the habitation of the scornful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:77: Then have patience (O Muhammad). Lo! the promise of Allah is true. And whether we let thee see a part of that which We promise them, or (whether) We cause thee to die, still unto Us they will be brought back.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:78: Verily We sent messengers before thee, among them those of whom We have told thee, and some of whom We have not told thee; and it was not given to any messenger that he should bring a portent save by Allah’s leave, but when Allah’s commandment cometh (the cause) is judged aright, and the followers of vanity will then be lost.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:79: Allah it is Who hath appointed for you cattle, that ye may ride on some of them, and eat of some -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:80: (Many) benefits ye have from them - and that ye may satisfy by their means a need that is in your breasts, and may be borne upon them as upon the ship.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:81: And He showeth you His tokens. Which, then, of the tokens of Allah do ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:82: Have they not travelled in the land to see the nature of the consequence for those before them ? They were more numerous than these, and mightier in power and (in the) traces (which they left behind them) in the earth. But all that they used to earn availed them not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:83: And when their messengers brought them clear proofs (of Allah’s Sovereignty) they exulted in the knowledge they (themselves) possessed. And that which they were wont to mock befell them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:84: Then, when they saw Our doom, they said: We believe in Allah only and reject (all) that we used to associate (with Him).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 40:85: But their faith could not avail them when they saw Our doom. This is Allah’s law which hath ever taken course for His bondmen. And then the disbelievers will be ruined.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:2: The revelation of this Book is from God, Exalted in Power, Full of Knowledge,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:3: Who forgiveth sin, accepteth repentance, is strict in punishment, and hath a long reach (in all things). there is no god but He: to Him is the final goal.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:4: None can dispute about the Signs of God but the Unbelievers. Let not, then, their strutting about through the land deceive thee!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:5: But (there were people) before them, who denied (the Signs),- the People of Noah, and the Confederates (of Evil) after them; and every People plotted against their prophet, to seize him, and disputed by means of vanities, therewith to condemn the Truth; but it was I that seized them! and how (terrible) was My Requital!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:6: Thus was the Decree of thy Lord proved true against the Unbelievers; that truly they are Companions of the Fire!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:7: Those who sustain the Throne (of God) and those around it Sing Glory and Praise to their Lord; believe in Him; and implore Forgiveness for those who believe: "Our Lord! Thy Reach is over all things, in Mercy and Knowledge. Forgive, then, those who turn in Repentance, and follow Thy Path; and preserve them from the Penalty of the Blazing Fire!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:8: "And grant, our Lord! that they enter the Gardens of Eternity, which Thou hast promised to them, and to the righteous among their fathers, their wives, and their posterity! For Thou art (He), the Exalted in Might, Full of Wisdom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:9: "And preserve them from (all) ills; and any whom Thou dost preserve from ills that Day,- on them wilt Thou have bestowed Mercy indeed: and that will be truly (for them) the highest Achievement".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:10: The Unbelievers will be addressed: "Greater was the aversion of God to you than (is) your aversion to yourselves, seeing that ye were called to the Faith and ye used to refuse."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:11: They will say: "Our Lord! twice hast Thou made us without life, and twice hast Thou given us Life! Now have we recognised our sins: Is there any way out (of this)?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:12: (The answer will be:) "This is because, when God was invoked as the Only (object of worship), ye did reject Faith, but when partners were joined to Him, ye believed! the Command is with God, Most High, Most Great!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:13: He it is Who showeth you his Signs, and sendeth down sustenance for you from the sky: but only those receive admonition who turn (to God).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:14: Call ye, then, upon God with sincere devotion to Him, even though the Unbelievers may detest it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:15: Raised high above ranks (or degrees), (He is) the Lord of the Throne (of Authority): by His Command doth He send the Spirit (of inspiration) to any of His servants he pleases, that it may warn (men) of the Day of Mutual Meeting,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:16: The Day whereon they will (all) come forth: not a single thing concerning them is hidden from God. Whose will be the dominion that Day?" That of God, the One the Irresistible!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:17: That Day will every soul be requited for what it earned; no injustice will there be that Day, for God is Swift in taking account.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:18: Warn them of the Day that is (ever) drawing near, when the hearts will (come) right up to the throats to choke (them); No intimate friend nor intercessor will the wrong-doers have, who could be listened to.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:19: (God) knows of (the tricks) that deceive with the eyes, and all that the hearts (of men) conceal.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:20: And God will judge with (justice and) Truth: but those whom (men) invoke besides Him, will not (be in a position) to judge at all. Verily it is God (alone) Who hears and sees (all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:21: Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of those before them? They were even superior to them in strength, and in the traces (they have left) in the land: but God did call them to account for their sins, and none had they to defend them against God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:22: That was because there came to them their apostles with Clear (Signs), but they rejected them: So God called them to account: for He is Full of Strength, Strict in Punishment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:23: Of old We sent Moses, with Our Signs and an authority manifest,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:24: To Pharaoh, Haman, and Qarun; but they called (him)" a sorcerer telling lies!"...
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:25: Now, when he came to them in Truth, from Us, they said, "Slay the sons of those who believe with him, and keep alive their females," but the plots of Unbelievers (end) in nothing but errors (and delusions)!...
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:26: Said Pharaoh: "Leave me to slay Moses; and let him call on his Lord! What I fear is lest he should change your religion, or lest he should cause mischief to appear in the land!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:27: Moses said: "I have indeed called upon my Lord and your Lord (for protection) from every arrogant one who believes not in the Day of Account!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:28: A believer, a man from among the people of Pharaoh, who had concealed his faith, said: "Will ye slay a man because he says, ’My Lord is God’?- when he has indeed come to you with Clear (Signs) from your Lord? and if he be a liar, on him is (the sin of) his lie: but, if he is telling the Truth, then will fall on you something of the (calamity) of which he warns you: Truly God guides not one who transgresses and lies!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:29: "O my People! Yours is the dominion this day: Ye have the upper hand in the land: but who will help us from the Punishment of God, should it befall us?" Pharaoh said: "I but point out to you that which I see (myself); Nor do I guide you but to the Path of Right!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:30: Then said the man who believed: "O my people! Truly I do fear for you something like the Day (of disaster) of the Confederates (in sin)!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:31: "Something like the fate of the People of Noah, the ’Ad, and the Thamud, and those who came after them: but God never wishes injustice to his Servants.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:32: "And O my people! I fear for you a Day when there will be Mutual calling (and wailing),-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:33: "A Day when ye shall turn your backs and flee: No defender shall ye have from God: Any whom God leaves to stray, there is none to guide...
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:34: "And to you there came Joseph in times gone by, with Clear Signs, but ye ceased not to doubt of the (Mission) for which he had come: At length, when he died, ye said: ’No apostle will God send after him.’ thus doth God leave to stray such as transgress and live in doubt,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:35: "(Such) as dispute about the Signs of God, without any authority that hath reached them, grievous and odious (is such conduct) in the sight of God and of the Believers. Thus doth God, seal up every heart - of arrogant and obstinate Transgressors."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:36: Pharaoh said: "O Haman! Build me a lofty palace, that I may attain the ways and means-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:37: "The ways and means of (reaching) the heavens, and that I may mount up to the God of Moses: But as far as I am concerned, I think (Moses) is a liar!" Thus was made alluring, in Pharaoh’s eyes, the evil of his deeds, and he was hindered from the Path; and the plot of Pharaoh led to nothing but perdition (for him).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:38: The man who believed said further: "O my people! Follow me: I will lead you to the Path of Right.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:39: "O my people! This life of the present is nothing but (temporary) convenience: It is the Hereafter that is the Home that will last.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:40: "He that works evil will not be requited but by the like thereof: and he that works a righteous deed - whether man or woman - and is a Believer- such will enter the Garden (of Bliss): Therein will they have abundance without measure.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:41: "And O my people! How (strange) it is for me to call you to Salvation while ye call me to the Fire!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:42: "Ye do call upon me to blaspheme against God, and to join with Him partners of whom I have no knowledge; and I call you to the Exalted in Power, Who forgives again and again!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:43: "Without doubt ye do call me to one who is not fit to be called to, whether in this world, or in the Hereafter; our return will be to God; and the Transgressors will be Companions of the Fire!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:44: "Soon will ye remember what I say to you (now), My (own) affair I commit to God: for God (ever) watches over His Servants."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:45: Then God saved him from (every) ill that they plotted (against him), but the burnt of the Penalty encompassed on all sides the People of Pharaoh.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:46: In front of the Fire will they be brought, morning and evening: And (the sentence will be) on the Day that Judgment will be established: "Cast ye the People of Pharaoh into the severest Penalty!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:47: Behold, they will dispute with each other in the Fire! The weak ones (who followed) will say to those who had been arrogant, "We but followed you: Can ye then take (on yourselves) from us some share of the Fire?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:48: Those who had been arrogant will say: "We are all in this (Fire)! Truly, God has judged between (his) Servants!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:49: Those in the Fire will say to the Keepers of Hell: "Pray to your Lord to lighten us the Penalty for a day (at least)!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:50: They will say: "Did there not come to you your apostles with Clear Signs?" They will say, "Yes". They will reply, "Then pray (as ye like)! But the prayer of those without Faith is nothing but (futile wandering) in (mazes of) error!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:51: We will, without doubt, help our apostles and those who believe, (both) in this world’s life and on the Day when the Witnesses will stand forth,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:52: The Day when no profit will it be to Wrong-doers to present their excuses, but they will (only) have the Curse and the Home of Misery.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:53: We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance, and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:54: A Guide and a Message to men of Understanding.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:55: Patiently, then, persevere: for the Promise of God is true: and ask forgiveness for thy fault, and celebrate the Praises of thy Lord in the evening and in the morning.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:56: Those who dispute about the signs of God without any authority bestowed on them,- there is nothing in their breasts but (the quest of) greatness, which they shall never attain to: seek refuge, then, in God: It is He Who hears and sees (all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:57: Assuredly the creation of the heavens and the earth is a greater (matter) than the creation of men: Yet most men understand not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:58: Not equal are the blind and those who (clearly) see: Nor are (equal) those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, and those who do evil. Little do ye learn by admonition!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:59: The Hour will certainly come: Therein is no doubt: Yet most men believe not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:60: And your Lord says: "Call on Me; I will answer your (Prayer): but those who are too arrogant to serve Me will surely find themselves in Hell - in humiliation!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:61: It is God Who has made the Night for you, that ye may rest therein, and the days as that which helps (you) to see. Verily God is full of Grace and Bounty to men: yet most men give no thanks.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:62: Such is God, your Lord, the Creator of all things, there is no god but He: Then how ye are deluded away from the Truth!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:63: Thus are deluded those who are wont to reject the Signs of God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:64: It is God Who has made for you the earth as a resting place, and the sky as a canopy, and has given you shape- and made your shapes beautiful,- and has provided for you Sustenance, of things pure and good;- such is God your Lord. So Glory to God, the Lord of the Worlds!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:65: He is the Living (One): There is no god but He: Call upon Him, giving Him sincere devotion. Praise be to God, Lord of the Worlds!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:66: Say: "I have been forbidden to invoke those whom ye invoke besides God,- seeing that the Clear Sings have come to me from my Lord; and I have been commanded to bow (in Islam) to the Lord of the Worlds."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:67: It is He Who has created you from dust then from a sperm-drop, then from a leech-like clot; then does he get you out (into the light) as a child: then lets you (grow and) reach your age of full strength; then lets you become old,- though of you there are some who die before;- and lets you reach a Term appointed; in order that ye may learn wisdom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:68: It is He Who gives Life and Death; and when He decides upon an affair, He says to it, "Be", and it is.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:69: Seest thou not those that dispute concerning the Sings of God? How are they turned away (from Reality)?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:70: Those who reject the Book and the (revelations) with which We sent our apostles: but soon shall they know,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:71: When the yokes (shall be) round their necks, and the chains; they shall be dragged along-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:72: In the boiling fetid fluid: then in the Fire shall they be burned;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:73: Then shall it be said to them: "Where are the (deities) to which ye gave part-worship-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:74: "In derogation of God?" They will reply: "They have left us in the lurch: Nay, we invoked not, of old, anything (that had real existence)." Thus does God leave the Unbelievers to stray.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:75: "That was because ye were wont to rejoice on the earth in things other than the Truth, and that ye were wont to be insolent.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:76: "Enter ye the gates of Hell, to dwell therein: and evil is (this) abode of the arrogant!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:77: So persevere in patience; for the Promise of God is true: and whether We show thee (in this life) some part of what We promise them,- or We take thy soul (to Our Mercy) (before that),-(in any case) it is to Us that they shall (all) return.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:78: We did aforetime send apostles before thee: of them there are some whose story We have related to thee, and some whose story We have not related to thee. It was not (possible) for any apostle to bring a sign except by the leave of God: but when the Command of God issued, the matter was decided in truth and justice, and there perished, there and then those who stood on Falsehoods.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:79: It is God Who made cattle for you, that ye may use some for riding and some for food;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:80: And there are (other) advantages in them for you (besides); that ye may through them attain to any need (there may be) in your hearts; and on them and on ships ye are carried.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:81: And He shows you (always) His Signs: then which of the Signs of God will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:82: Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of those before them? They were more numerous than these and superior in strength and in the traces (they have left) in the land: Yet all that they accomplished was of no profit to them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:83: For when their apostles came to them with Clear Signs, they exulted in such knowledge (and skill) as they had; but that very (Wrath) at which they were wont to scoff hemmed them in.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:84: But when they saw Our Punishment, they said: "We believe in God,- the one God - and we reject the partners we used to join with Him."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 40:85: But their professing the Faith when they (actually) saw Our Punishment was not going to profit them. (Such has been) God’s Way of dealing with His Servants (from the most ancient times). And even thus did the Rejecters of God perish (utterly)!

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:2: The sending down of the Book is from God the All-mighty, the All-knowing,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:3: Forgiver of sins, Accepter of penitence, Terrible in retribution, the Bountiful; there is no god but He, and unto Him is the homecoming.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:4: None but the unbelievers dispute concerning the signs of God; so let not their going to and fro in the land delude thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:5: The people of Noah before them also cried lies, and the parties after them; every nation purposed against their Messenger to seize him, and disputed with falsehood that they might rebut thereby the truth. Then I seized them; and how was My retribution!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:6: Even so the Word of thy Lord was realised against the unbelievers, that they are the inhabitants of the Fire.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:7: Those who bear the Throne, and those round about it proclaim the praise of their Lord, and believe in Him, and they ask forgiveness for those who believe: ’Our Lord, Thou embracest every thing in mercy and knowledge; therefore forgive those who have repented, and follow Thy way, and guard them against the chastisement of Hell.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:8: Our Lord, and admit them to the Gardens of Eden that Thou hast promised them and those who were righteous of their fathers, and their wives, and their seed; surely Thou art the All-mighty, the All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:9: And guard them against evil deeds; whomsoever Thou guardest against evil deeds on that day, on him Thou hast had mercy; and that is indeed the mighty triumph.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:10: It shall be proclaimed to the unbelievers, ’Surely God’s hatred is greater than your hatred one of another, when you were called unto belief, and disbelieved.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:11: They shall say, ’Our Lord, Thou hast caused us to die two deaths and Thou hast given us twice to live; now we confess our sins. Is there any way to go forth?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:12: That is because, when God was called to alone, you disbelieved; but if others are associated with Him, then you believe. Judgment belongs to God, the All-high, the All-great.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:13: It is He who shows you His signs and sends down to you out of heaven provision; yet none remembers but he who repents.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:14: So call unto God, making your religion His sincerely, though the unbelievers be averse.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:15: Exalter of ranks is He, Possessor of the Throne, casting the Spirit of His bidding upon whomever He will of His servants, that he may warn them of the Day of Encounter,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:16: the day they sally forth, and naught of theirs is hidden from God. ’Whose is’ the Kingdom today?’ ’God’s, the One, the Omnipotent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:17: Today each soul shall be recompensed for that it has earned; no wrong today. Surely God is swift at the reckoning.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:18: And warn them against the Day of the Imminent when, choking with anguish, the hearts are in the throats and the evildoers have not one loyal friend, no intercessor to be heeded.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:19: He knows the treachery of the eyes and what the breasts conceal.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:20: God shall decide justly, and those they call on, apart from Him, shall not decide by any means. surely God is the All-hearing, the All-seeing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:21: What, have they not journeyed in the land and beheld how was the end of those before them? They were stronger than themselves in might and left firmer traces in the earth; yet God seized them in their sins, and they had none to defend them from God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:22: That was because their Messengers came to them with the clear signs; but they disbelieved, so God seized them. Surely He is All-strong, terrible in retribution.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:23: We also sent Moses with Our signs and a clear authority,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:24: to Pharaoh, Haman and Korah; they said, ’A lying sorcerer!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:25: And when he brought them the truth from Us, they said, ’Slay the sons of those who believe with him, and spare their women.’ But the guile of the unbelievers is ever in error.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:26: And Pharaoh said, ’Let me slay Moses, and let him call to his Lord. I fear that he may change, your religion, or that he may cause corruption to appear in the land.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:27: And Moses said, ’I take refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every man who is proud, and believes not in the Day of Reckoning.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:28: Then said a certain man, a believer ’of Pharaoh’s folk that kept hidden his belief, ’What, will you slay a man because he says, "My Lord is God," yet he has brought you the clear signs from your Lord? If he is a liar, his lying is upon his own head; but if he is truthful, somewhat of that he promises you will smite you. Surely God guides not him who is prodigal and a liar.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:29: O my people! yours is the kingdom this day, being masters in the land, but who will help us against the punishment of Allah if it come to us? Firon said: I do not show you aught but that which I see (myself), and I do not make you follow any but the right way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:30: Then said he who believed, ’My people, truly I fear for you the like of the day of the parties,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:31: the like of the case of Noah’s people, Ad, Thamood, and those after them; and God desires not wrong for His servants.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:32: O my people, I fear for you the Day of Invocation,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:33: the day you turn about, retreating, having none to defend you from God; and whomsoever God leads astray, no guide has he.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:34: Joseph brought you the clear signs before, yet you continued in doubt concerning that he brought you until, when he perished, you said, "God will never send forth a Messenger after him." Even, so God leads astray the prodigal and the doubter.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:35: (Those who dispute concerning the signs of God, without any authority come to them, very hateful is that in the sight of God and the believers; ’so God sets a seal on every heart proud’, arrogant.)
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:36: Pharaoh said, ’Haman, build for me a tower, that haply so I may reach the cords,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:37: the cords of the heavens, and look upon Moses’ God; for I think that he is a liar.’ So the evil of his deeds was decked out fair to Pharaoh, and he was barred from the way, and Pharaoh’s guile came only to ruin.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:38: Then said he who believed, ’My people, follow me, and I will guide you in the way of rectitude.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:39: O my people, surely this present life is but a passing enjoyment; surely the world to come is the abode of stability.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:40: Whosoever does an evil deed shall be recompensed only with the like of it, but whosoever does a righteous deed, be it male or female, believing -- those shall enter Paradise, therein provided without reckoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:41: O my people, how is it with me, that I call you to salvation, and you call me to the Fire?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:42: You call me to disbelieve in God, and to associate with Him that whereof I have no knowledge, while I call you to the All-mighty, the All-forgiving.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:43: No doubt that what you call me to has no call heard, in this world or in the world to come, that to God we return, and that the prodigal are the inhabitants of the Fire.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:44: You will remember what I say to you. I commit my affair to God; surely God sees His servants.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:45: So God guarded him against the evil things of their devising, and there encompassed the folk of Pharaoh the evil chastisement,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:46: the Fire, to which they shall be exposed morning and evening; and on the day when the Hour is come: ’Admit the folk of Pharaoh into the most terrible chastisement!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:47: And when they argue one with the other in the Fire, and the weak say unto those who waxed proud, ’Why, we were your followers; will you avail us now against any part of the Fire?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:48: Then those who waxed proud shall say, ’Every one of us is in it; indeed, God already has passed judgment between His servants.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:49: And those who are in the Fire will say to the keepers of Gehenna, ’Call on your Lord, to lighten for us one day of the chastisement!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:50: They shall say, ’Did not your Messengers bring you the clear signs?’ They shall say, ’Yes indeed.’ They shall say, ’Then do you call!’ But the calling of the unbelievers is only in error.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:51: Surely We shall help Our Messengers and those who have believed, in the present life, and upon the day when the witnesses arise,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:52: upon the day when their excuses shall not profit the evildoers, and theirs shall be the curse, and theirs the evil abode.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:53: We also gave Moses the guidance, and We bequeathed upon the Children of Israel the Book
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:54: for a guidance and for a reminder to men possessed of minds.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:55: So be thou patient; surely God’s promise is true. And ask forgiveness for thy sin, and proclaim the praise of thy Lord at evening and dawn.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:56: Those who dispute concerning the signs of God, without any authority come to them, in their breasts is only pride, that they shall never attain. So seek thou refuge in God; surely He is the All-hearing, the All-seeing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:57: Certainly the creation of the heavens and earth is greater than the creation of men; but most men know it not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:58: Not equal are the blind and the seeing man, those who believe and do deeds of righteousness, and the wrong-doer. Little do you reflect.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:59: The Hour is coming, no doubt of it, but most men do not believe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:60: Your Lord has said, ’Call upon Me and I will answer you. Surely those who wax too proud to do Me service shall enter Gehenna utterly abject.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:61: It is God who made for you the night, to repose in it, and the day, to see. Surely God is bountiful to men, but most men are not thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:62: That then is God, your Lord, the Creator of everything; there is no god but He. How then are you perverted?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:63: Even so perverted are they who deny the signs of God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:64: It is God who made for you the earth a fixed place and heaven for an edifice; And He shaped you, and shaped you well, and provided you with the good things. That then is God, your Lord, so blessed be God, the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:65: He is the Living One; there is no god but He. So call upon Him, making your religion His sincerely. Praise belongs to God, the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:66: Say: ’I am forbidden to serve those you call on apart from God once the clear signs came to me from my Lord; and I am commanded to surrender to the Lord of All Being.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:67: It is He who created you of dust then of a sperm-drop, then of a blood-clot, then He delivers you as infants, then that you may come of age, then that you may be old men -- though some of you there are who die before it -- and that you may reach a stated term; haply you will understand.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:68: It is He who gives life, and makes to die; and when He decrees a thing, He but says to it ’Be,’ and it is.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:69: Hast thou not regarded those who dispute concerning the signs of God, how they are turned about?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:70: Those who cry lies to the Book and that wherewith We sent Our Messengers -- soon they will know!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:71: When the fetters and chains are on their necks, and they dragged
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:72: into the boiling water, then into the Fire they are poured;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:73: then it is said to them, ’Where are those you associated, apart from God?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:74: They shall say, ’They have gone astray from us; nay, but it was nothing at all that we called upon aforetime.’ Even so God leads astray the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:75: ’That is because you rejoiced in the earth without right, and were exultant.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:76: Enter the gates of Gehenna, to dwell therein forever.’ How evil is the lodging of those that are proud!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:77: So be thou patient; surely God’s promise is true. Whether We show thee a part of that We promise them, or We call thee unto Us, to Us they shall be returned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:78: We sent Messengers before thee; of some We have related to thee, and some We have not related to thee. It was not for any Messenger to bring a sign, save by God’s leave. When God’s command comes, justly the issue shall be decided; then the vain-doers shall be lost.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:79: It is God who appointed for you the cattle, some of them to ride and of some you eat;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:80: other uses also you have in them; and that on them you may attain a need in your breasts, and upon them and on the ships you are carried.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:81: And He shows you His signs; then which of God’s signs do you reject?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:82: What, have they not journeyed in the land and beheld how was the end of those before them? They were stronger than themselves in might and left firmer traces in the earth; yet that they earned did not avail them.
