Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:83: So, when their Messengers brought them the clear signs, they rejoiced in what knowledge they had, and were encompassed by that they mocked at.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:84: Then, when they saw Our might, they said, ’We believe in God alone, and we disbelieve in that we were associating with Him.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 40:85: But their belief when they saw Our might did not profit them -- the wont of God, as in the past, touching His servants; then the unbelievers shall be lost.

Muhammad Asad.verse 40:2: THE BESTOWAL from on high of this divine writ issues from God, the Almighty, the All-Knowing,
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:3: forgiving sins and accepting repentance, severe in retribution, limitless in His bounty. There is no deity save Him: with Him is all journeys’ end.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:4: NONE BUT THOSE who are bent on denying the truth would call God’s messages in question. But let it not deceive thee that they seem to be able to do as they please on earth:
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:5: to the truth gave the lie, before their time, the people of Noah and, after them, all those [others] who were leagued together [against God’s message-bearers]; and each of those communities schemed against the apostle sent unto them, aiming to lay hands on him; and they contended [against his message] with fallacious arguments, so as to render void the truth thereby: but then I took them to task – and how awesome was My retribution!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:6: And thus shall thy Sustainer’s word come true against all who are bent on denying the truth: they shall find themselves in the fire [of hell].
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:7: THEY WHO BEAR [within themselves the knowledge of] the throne of [God’s] almightiness, as well as all who are near it, extol their Sustainer’s limitless glory and praise, and have faith in Him, and ask forgiveness for all [others] who have attained to faith: "O our Sustainer! Thou embracest all things within [Thy] grace and knowledge: forgive, then, their sins unto those who repent and follow Thy path, and preserve them from suffering through the blazing fire!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:8: "And, O our Sustainer, bring them into the gardens of perpetual bliss which Thou hast promised them, together with the righteous from among their forebears, and their spouses, and their offspring – for, verily, Thou alone art almighty, truly wise –
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:9: and preserve them from [doing] evil deeds: for anyone whom on that Day [of Judgment] Thou wilt have preserved from [the taint of] evil deeds, him wilt Thou have graced with Thy mercy: and that, that will be the triumph supreme!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:10: [But,] behold, as for those who are bent on denying the truth – [on that same Day] a voice will call out unto them: "Indeed, greater than your [present] loathing of yourselves was God’s loathing of you [at the time] when you were called unto faith but went on denying the truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:11: [Whereupon] they will exclaim: "O our Sustainer! Twice hast Thou caused us to die, just as twice Thou hast brought us to life! But now that we have acknowledged our sins, is there any way out [of this second death]?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:12: [And they will be told:] "This [has befallen you] because, whenever the One God was invoked, you denied this truth; whereas, when divinity was ascribed to aught beside Him, you believed [in it]! But all judgment rests with God, the Exalted, the Great!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:13: HE IT IS who shows you His wonders [in all nature], and sends down sustenance for you from the sky: but none bethinks himself [thereof] save those who are wont to turn to God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:14: Invoke, then, God, sincere in your faith in Him alone, however hateful this may be to those who deny the truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:15: High above all orders [of being] is He, in almightiness enthroned. By His Own will does He bestow inspiration upon whomever He wills of His servants, so as to warn [all human beings of the coming] of the Day when they shall meet Him –
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:16: the Day when they shall come forth [from death], with nothing of themselves hidden from God. With whom will sovereignty rest on that Day? With God, the One who holds absolute sway over all that exists!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:17: On that Day will every human being be requited for what he has earned: no wrong [will be done] on that Day: verily, swift in reckoning is God!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:18: Hence, warn them of that Day which draws ever nearer, when the hearts will chokingly come up to the throats: no loving friend will the evildoers have, nor any intercessor who would be heeded:
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:19: [for] He is aware of the [most] stealthy glance, and of all that the hearts would conceal.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:20: And God will judge in accordance with truth and justice, whereas those [beings] whom they invoke beside Him cannot judge at all: for, verily, God alone is all-hearing, all-seeing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:21: Have they, then, never journeyed about the earth and beheld what happened in the end to those [deniers of the truth] who lived before their time? Greater were they in power than they are, and in the impact which they left on earth: but God took them to task for their sins, and they had none to defend them against God:
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:22: this, because their apostles had come to them with all evidence of the truth, and yet they rejected it: and so God took them to task – for, verily, He is powerful, severe in retribution!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:23: THUS, INDEED, did We send Moses with Our messages and a manifest authority [from Us]
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:24: unto Pharaoh, and Hāmān, and Qārūn; but they [only] said, "A spellbinder is he, a liar!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:25: Now [as for Pharaoh and his followers,] when he came to them, setting forth the truth from Us, they said, "Slay the sons of those who share his beliefs, and spare [only] their women!" – but the guile of those deniers of the truth could not lead to aught but failure.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:26: And Pharaoh said: "Leave it to me to slay Moses – and let him invoke his [alleged] sustainer! Behold, I fear lest he cause you to change your religion, or lest he cause corruption to prevail in the land!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:27: But Moses said: "With [Him who is] my Sustainer as well as your Sustainer have I indeed found refuge from everyone who, immersed in false pride, will not believe in [the coming of] the Day of Reckoning!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:28: At that, a believing man of Pharaoh’s family, who [until then] had concealed his faith, exclaimed: "Would you slay a man because he says, ‘God is my Sustainer’ – seeing, withal, that he has brought you all evidence of this truth from your Sustainer? Now if he be a liar, his lie will fall back on him; but if he is a man of truth, something [of the punishment] whereof he warns you is bound to befall you: for, verily, God would not grace with His guidance one who has wasted his own self by lying [about Him].
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:29: "O my people! Yours is the dominion today, [and] most eminent are you on earth: but who will rescue us from God’s punishment, once it befalls us?" Said Pharaoh: "I but want to make you see what I see myself; and I would never make you follow any path but that of rectitude!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:30: Thereupon exclaimed he who had attained to faith: "O my people! Verily, I fear for you the like of what one day befell those others who were leagued together [against God’s truth] –
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:31: the like of what happened to Noah’s people, and to [the tribes of] ’ād and Thamūd and those who came after them! And, withal. God does not will any wrong for His creatures.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:32: "And, O my people, I fear for you [the coming of] that Day of [Judgment – the Day when you will be] calling unto one another [in distress] –
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:33: the Day when you will [wish to] turn your backs and flee, having none to defend you against God: for he whom God lets go astray can never find any guide.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:34: "And [remember:] it was to you that Joseph came aforetime with all evidence of the truth; but you never ceased to throw doubt on all [the messages] that he brought you – so much so that when he died, you said, ‘Never will God send any apostle [even] after him!’ "In this way God lets go astray such as waste their own selves by throwing suspicion [on His revelations] –
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:35: such as would call God’s messages in question without having any evidence therefor: [a sin] exceedingly loathsome in the sight of God and of those who have attained to faith. It is in this way that God sets a seal on every arrogant, self-exalting heart."
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:36: But Pharaoh said: "O Hāmān! Build me a lofty tower, that haply I may attain to the [right] means –
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:37: the means of approach to the heavens – and that [thus] I may have a look at the god of Moses: for, behold, I am indeed certain that he is a liar!" And thus, goodly seemed unto Pharaoh the evil of his own doings, and so he was barred from the path [of truth]: and Pharaoh’s guile did not lead to aught but ruin.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:38: Still, the man who had attained to faith went on: "O my people! Follow me: I shall guide you onto the path of rectitude!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:39: "O my people! This worldly life is but a brief enjoyment, whereas, behold, the life to come is the home abiding.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:40: [There,] anyone who has done a bad deed will be requited with no more than the like thereof, whereas anyone, be it man or woman, who has done righteous deeds and is a believer withal – all such will enter paradise, wherein they shall be blest with good beyond all reckoning!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:41: "And, O my people, how is it that I summon you to salvation, the while you summon me to the fire? –
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:42: [for] you call upon me to deny [the oneness of] God and to ascribe a share in His divinity to aught of which I cannot [possibly] have any knowledge, the while I summon you to [a cognition of] the Almighty, the All-Forgiving!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:43: "There is no doubt that what you summon me to is something that has no claim to being invoked either in this world or in the life to come – as [there is no doubt] that unto God is our return, and that they who have wasted their own selves shall find themselves in the fire:
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:44: and at that time you will [have cause to] remember what I am telling you [now]. "But [as for me,] I commit myself unto God: for, verily, God sees all that is in [the hearts of] His servants."
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:45: And God preserved him from the evil of their scheming, whereas suffering vile was to encompass Pharaoh’s folk:
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:46: the fire [of the hereafter – that fire] which they had been made to contemplate [in vain], morning and evening: for on the Day when the Last Hour dawns [God will say], "Make Pharaoh’s folk enter upon suffering most severe!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:47: AND LO! They [who in life were wont to deny the truth] will contend with one another in the fire [of the hereafter]; and then the weak will say unto those who had gloried in their arrogance, "Behold, we were but your followers: can you, then, relieve us of some [of our] share of this fire?" –
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:48: [to which] they who had [once] been arrogant will reply, "Behold, we are all in it [together]! Verily, God has judged between His creatures!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:49: And they who are in the fire will say to the keepers of hell, "Pray unto your Sustainer that He lighten, [though it be] for one day [only], this suffering of ours!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:50: [But the keepers of hell] will ask, "Is it not [true] that your apostles came unto you with all evidence of the truth?" Those [in the fire] will reply, "Yea, indeed." [And the keepers of hell] will say, "Pray, then!" – for the prayer of those who deny the truth cannot lead to aught but delusion.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:51: BEHOLD, We shall indeed succour Our apostles and those who have attained to faith, [both] in this world’s life and on the Day when all the witnesses shall stand up –
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:52: the Day when their excuses will be of no avail to the evildoers, seeing that their lot will be rejection from all that is good, and a woeful hereafter.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:53: And, indeed, We bestowed aforetime [Our] guidance on Moses, and [thus] made the children of Israel heirs to the divine writ [revealed to him]
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:54: as a [means of] guidance and a reminder for those who were endowed with insight:
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:55: hence, remain thou patient in adversity – for, verily, God’s promise always comes true – and ask forgiveness for thy sins, and extol thy Sustainer’s glory and praise by night and by day.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:56: Behold, as for those who call God’s messages in question without having any evidence therefor – in their hearts is nothing but overweening self-conceit, which they will never be able to satisfy: seek thou, then, refuge with God – for, verily, He alone is all-hearing, all-seeing!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:57: Greater indeed than the creation of man is the creation of the heavens and the earth: yet most men do not understand [what this implies].
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:58: But [then,] the blind and the seeing are not equal; and neither [can] they who have attained to faith and do good works and the doers of evil [be deemed equal]. How seldom do you keep this in mind!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:59: Verily, the Last Hour is sure to come: of this there is no doubt; yet most men will not believe it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:60: But your Sustainer says: "Call unto Me, [and] I shall respond to you! Verily, they who are too proud to worship Me will enter hell, abased!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:61: IT IS GOD who has made the night for you, so that you might rest therein, and the day, to make [you] see. Behold, God is indeed limitless in His bounty unto man – but most men are ungrateful.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:62: Such is God, your Sustainer, the Creator of all that exists: there is no deity save Him. How perverted, then, are your minds!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:63: [For] thus it is: perverted are the minds of those who knowingly reject God’s messages.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:64: It is God who has made the earth a resting-place for you and the sky a canopy, and has formed you – and formed you so well – and provided for you sustenance out of the good things of life. Such is God, your Sustainer: hallowed, then, is God, the Sustainer of all the worlds!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:65: He is the Ever-Living; there is no deity save Him: call, then, unto Him [alone], sincere in your faith in Him. All praise is due to God, the Sustainer of all the worlds!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:66: Say: "Since all evidence of the truth has come to me from my Sustainer, I am forbidden to worship [any of] those beings whom you invoke instead of God; and I am bidden to surrender myself to the Sustainer of all the worlds."
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:67: It is He who creates you out of dust, and then out of a drop of sperm, and then out of a germ-cell; and then He brings you forth as children; and then [He ordains] that you reach maturity, and then, that you grow old – though some of you [He causes to] die earlier – and [all this He ordains] so that you might reach a term set [by Him], and that you might [learn to] use your reason.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:68: It is He who grants life and deals death; and when He wills a thing to be, He but says unto it, "Be" – and it is.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:69: ART THOU NOT aware of how far they who call God’s messages in question have lost sight of the truth? –
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:70: they who give the lie to this divine writ and [thus] to all [the messages] with which We sent forth Our apostles [of old]? But in time they will come to know [how blind they have been: they will know it on Judgment Day],
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:71: when they shall have to carry the shackles and chains [of their own making] around their necks, and are dragged
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:72: into burning despair, and in the end become fuel for the fire [of hell].
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:73: And then they will be asked: "Where now are those [powers] to which you were wont to ascribe divinity
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:74: side by side with God?" They will answer: "They have forsaken us – or, rather, what we were wont to invoke aforetime did not exist at all!" [And they will be told:] "It is thus that God lets the deniers of the truth go astray:
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:75: this is an outcome of your having arrogantly exulted on earth without any [concern for what is] right, and of your having been so full of self-conceit!
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:76: Enter [now] the gates of hell, therein to abide: and how vile an abode for all who are given to false pride!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:77: HENCE, remain thou patient in adversity – for, verily, God’s promise always comes true. And whether We show thee [in this world] something of what We hold in store for those [deniers of the truth], or whether We cause thee to die [ere that retribution takes place – know that, in the end], it is unto Us that they will be brought back.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:78: And, indeed, [O Muhammad,] We sent forth apostles before thy time, some of them We have mentioned to thee, and some of them We have not mentioned to thee. And it was not given to any apostle to bring forth a miracle other than by God’s leave. Yet when God’s will becomes manifest, judgment will [already] have been passed in all justice, and lost will be, then and there, all who tried to reduce to nothing [whatever they could not understand].
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:79: It is God who [at all times works wonders for you: thus, He] provides for you [all manner of] livestock, so that on some of them you may ride, and from some derive your food,
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:80: and find [yet other] benefits in them; and that through them you may attain to the fulfilment of [many] a heartfelt need: for on them, as on ships, you are borne [through life].
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:81: And [thus] He displays His wonders before you: which, then, of God’s wonders can you still deny?
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:82: HAVE THEY, then, never journeyed about the earth and beheld what happened in the end to those [deniers of the truth] who lived before their time? More numerous were they, and greater in power than they are, and in the impact which they left on earth: but all that they ever achieved was of no avail to them –
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:83: for when their apostles came to them with all evidence of the truth, they arrogantly exulted in whatever knowledge they [already] possessed: and [so, in the end,] they were overwhelmed by the very thing which they were wont to deride.
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:84: And then, when they [clearly] beheld Our punishment, they said: "We have come to believe in the One God, and we have renounced all belief in that to which we were wont to ascribe a share in His divinity!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 40:85: But their attaining to faith after they had beheld Our punishment could not possibly benefit them – such being the way of God that has always obtained for His creatures – and so, then and there, lost were they who had denied the truth.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:2: This is revelation of the Book from Allah, the Mighty, the All-Knowing,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:3: the One who forgives sins and accepts repentance, the One who is severe in punishment, the One who is the source of all power. There is no god but He. To Him is the ultimate return (of all).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:4: No one quarrels about the verses of Allah, except those who disbelieve. So, their (prosperous) movements in the cities should not deceive you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:5: Before these, the people of NūH and the groups after them had rejected (the messengers). Every group intended to seize their messenger, and raised disputes on the basis of falsehood, so that they might refute the truth with it, hence I seized them. So, how was My punishment?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:6: And similarly, the word of your Lord has become due against those who disbelieve-that they are the people of the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:7: Those who are bearing the Throne and those who are around it pronounce the purity of your Lord along with His praise, and believe in Him, and pray for the forgiveness of those who believe, (saying): “Our Lord, Your mercy and knowledge comprehends everything; so forgive those who repent and follow Your way, and save them from the punishment of the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:8: And, our Lord, admit them to the eternal gardens of Jannah (Paradise) that You have promised for them, and (admit) those as well who did good from among their fathers and wives and children. You, only You, are the Mighty, the Wise,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:9: and save them from evils (of punishment). And whomsoever you save from evils that day, it is surely because you bless him with mercy. And that is the great achievement indeed.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:10: Those who disbelieve will be addressed (by a voice saying): “Allah’s hatred (for you), when you were invited to the true faith and you refused, was greater than your hatred for yourselves (today when you are hating your own selves out of remorse).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:11: They will say, “Our Lord, You gave us death twice and You gave us life twice. Now we confess our sins. So, is there any way to come out of here?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:12: (The reply will be, “No.) This is because whenever Allah alone was invoked, you used to disbelieve, and if partners were associated with Him, you used to believe. Now the decision lies with Allah, the High, the Great.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:13: It is He who shows you His signs and sends down provision for you from the sky; and no one takes lesson but the one who turns to Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:14: So, worship Allah, making your submission exclusive for Him, even though the disbelievers dislike (it).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:15: He is High in stations, the Lord of the Throne. He sends the spirit down, under His command, on whomever He wills from among His servants, so that he warns of the Day of Encounter -
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:16: the day they will come in open view. Nothing about them will remain hidden from Allah. To whom belongs the kingdom today? To Allah alone, the One, the All-Dominant.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:17: Today, everyone will be recompensed for what one earned. There is no injustice today. Surely, Allah is swift in reckoning.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:18: And warn them of the Day of approaching horror, when hearts will jump up into the throats, (and they will be) choked. There will be neither a friend for the unjust, nor an intercessor to be listened to.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:19: He knows the treachery of the eyes and whatever is concealed by hearts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:20: He will give His judgment with truth. And those whom they invoke beside Him cannot judge anything. Surely, it is Allah who is Hearing, Seeing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:21: Have they not traveled through the earth and seen how was the fate of those who used to be before them? They were stronger than these in power and in traces left on the earth, but Allah seized them because of their sins. There was no one to save them from Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:22: That was because messengers used to come to them with clear signs, but they disbelieved. Then, Allah seized them. Surely, He is Strong, severe in punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:23: Indeed We sent Mūsā with Our signs and a manifest proof
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:24: to Pharaoh and Hāmān and Qārūn, but they said, “He is a sorcerer, a liar.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:25: And when he brought them the truth from Us, they said, “Kill the sons of those who have accepted faith with him, and spare the lives of their women.” But the plot of the disbelievers is nothing but a failure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:26: And Pharaoh said, “Let me kill Mūsā, and let him call his Lord. I am afraid that he will change your religion or he will cause havoc to appear in the land.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:27: And Mūsā said, “I have sought protection of my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant man who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:28: And said a believing man from the House of Pharaoh who had kept his faith secret, “Would you kill a man because he says - ‘Allah is my Lord’ - while he has come to you with clear signs from your Lord? If he is a liar, his lie will fall back on himself, and if he is truthful, some of that (punishment) of which he warns you will afflict you. Indeed, Allah does not give guidance to anyone who is transgressor, a liar.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:29: O my people, the kingdom is yours today, while you are dominant on the land. But, who is going to help us against Allah’s punishment, if it comes upon us?” Pharaoh said, “I do not give you an opinion unless I myself believe it to be correct, and I do not direct you to anything but to the right way.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:30: Said he who had believed, “I fear for you something like a day of the (disbelieving) groups (of the past),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:31: like the fate of the people of NūH and ‘Ād and Thamūd and those who were after them - and Allah does not intend to do any injustice to His servants.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:32: And O my people, I fear for you a day in which people will call one another,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:33: a day when you will turn back on your heels, having no one to save you from Allah - but, whomever Allah lets go astray, for him there is no one to guide.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:34: And Yūsuf had already come to you earlier with clear signs, but you remained in suspicion about what he brought to you - until when he died, you said, ‘Allah will never send a messenger after him.’ That is how Allah lets go astray anyone who crosses limits and lives in doubt, -
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:35: those who quarrel in Allah’s verses without any authority having reached them. It is terribly hateful with Allah and with those who believe. That is how Allah stamps a seal on the entire heart of an arrogant tyrant.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:36: And Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) said, “O Hāmān, make a tower for me, perhaps I could reach the ways -
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:37: the ways to the heavens, and peek towards the God of Mūsā. And indeed I deem him a liar.” That is how his evil deeds were made attractive to Fir‘aun, and (how) he was held back from the way. The evil design of Fir‘aun was (to end) in nothing but ruin.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:38: And said he who had believed, “O my people, follow me, I will show you the path of guidance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:39: O my people, this life of the world is only a (momentary) benefit, while the Hereafter is, indeed, the place of permanent living.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:40: The one who does something evil will not be punished but in its equal proportion, but the one who does a righteous deed, be he male or female, while he is a believer, then, such people will enter the Jannah (Paradise) where they will be provided with bounties beyond reckoning.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:41: And O my people, what is wrong with me that I call you to salvation and you call me to the Fire?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:42: You invite me to reject my belief in Allah and ascribe to Him partners about whom I have no knowledge, while I invite you to (Him who is) the Mighty, the Most-Forgiving.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:43: It is obvious that those (gods) to whom you are inviting me are not worth calling, neither in this world nor in the world to come, and that we have to return back to Allah, and that the transgressors are indeed the people of the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:44: Soon you will remember what I am saying to you. And I entrust my matter with Allah. Surely, Allah has all (His) servants in sight.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:45: Then Allah saved him from the evils of what they designed, and the House of Pharaoh was encircled by an evil punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:46: It is the Fire before which they are presented morning and evening. And on the day when the Hour (of final judgment) will take place, (the order will be released,): “Admit the family of Pharaoh into the most severe punishment.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:47: And (worth remembering is the time) when they (the infidels) will argue with each other in the Fire. So, the weak will say to those who were arrogant, “Surely, we used to be your followers, would you, then, stand for us in (suffering at least a) part of the (punishment of) Fire?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:48: Those who were arrogant will say, “We all are in it. Allah has already passed the judgment between (His) servants.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:49: And those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Jahannam (Hell), “Pray to your Lord to lighten the punishment for us some day.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:50: They will say, “Had your messengers not been coming to you with open signs?” They will say, “Of course, (they had come).” They (the keepers) will say, “Then, keep praying” - but praying of disbelievers (in the Hereafter) is only in vain.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:51: Surely, We do help Our messengers and the believers, in the worldly life, as well as (we will help them) on the day in which witnesses will stand (to give their testimony)-
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:52: a day when apology of the unjust will bring them no benefit, and on them shall be the curse, and for them will be the evil abode.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:53: We gave Guidance to Mūsā, while We made the children of Isrā’īl inherit the Book -
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:54: as a guide and advice for people of understanding.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:55: So, be patient - surely the promise of Allah is true - and seek forgiveness for your sins, and proclaim the purity and praise of your Lord in the afternoon and at dawn.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:56: Surely, those who quarrel in Allah’s verses without any authority having reached them, there is nothing in their hearts but pride of greatness that they are not (able) to reach. So, seek refuge with Allah. Surely, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:57: Certainly, the creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of human beings, but most human beings do not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:58: The blind one and the sighted one are not equal, and those who believed and did good deeds and the evil ones are not (equal) either. Little you heed to the advice!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:59: Certainly, the Hour is bound to come. There is no doubt in it, but most of the people do not believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:60: Your Lord has said, “Call Me, I will respond to you. Definitely those who show arrogance against worshipping Me shall enter Jahannam (Hell) with disgrace.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:61: Allah is the One who made for you the night, so that you may have rest in it, and the day to let you see. Surely, Allah is most kind to people, but most of the people do not offer gratitude.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:62: This is Allah, your Lord, the Creator of everything. There is no god but He. Then, from where are you being reversed (by your selfish desires)?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:63: Similarly reversed were those who used to deny Our verses.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:64: Allah is the One who made for you the earth a place to live, and the sky a roof, and shaped you, and made your shapes so good - and provided you with a lot of good things. That is Allah, your Lord. So, Glorious is Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:65: He is Ever-living. There is no god but He. So worship Him making your submission exclusive for Him. All praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:66: Say, “I have been ordered not to worship those whom you invoke beside Allah when clear signs from my Lord have (already) come to me, and I have been ordered that I should submit to the Lord of the worlds.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:67: He is the One who created you from dust, then from a drop of semen, then from a clot. After that, He takes you out as an infant. Then, (He makes you grow) so that you reach your full maturity, and, thereafter, become old - and some of you die earlier - and so that you reach the appointed term, and so that you understand.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:68: He is the One who gives life and brings death, and when He decides to do something, He only says to it: “Be” and it comes to be.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:69: Have you not seen those who quarrel in Allah’s verses? From where are they being turned away (by their selfish desires?)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:70: - those who rejected the Book and what We sent with Our messengers. So, they will soon come to know,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:71: when shackles will be round their necks, and chains. They will be dragged
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:72: into the hot water after which they will be thrown into the Fire as a fuel.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:73: Then, it will be said to them, “Where are those whom you used to associate (in worship)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:74: beside Allah?” They will say, “They are lost to us, rather, we used to invoke nothing at all.” This is how Allah makes disbelievers get lost.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:75: (It will be said to them,) “This is because you used to rejoice on the earth wrongfully, and because you used to show arrogance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:76: Enter the gates of Jahannam to live in it forever. So, how evil is the abode of the arrogant.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:77: Therefore, be patient. Surely, Allah’s promise is true. Then, (O Prophet,) whether We show you (in your life) a part of the promise We are making to them, or make you die (before they are punished), in any case they have to be returned to Us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:78: We had sent messengers before you. Among them there are those whose history We have narrated to you, and of them there are those whose history We did not narrate to you. And it is not up to a messenger that he could come up with a sign without permission from Allah. So, when the command of Allah will come, matters will stand decided justly, and on that occasion all adherents of falsehood will turn into losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:79: Allah is the One who made for you the cattle, so that you may ride some of them,- and of them you eat;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:80: and for you there are (other) benefits in them- and so that, (by riding) on them, you meet any need you have in your hearts; and on them and on boats you are carried.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:81: He shows you His signs. Then, which of the signs of Allah would you (still) deny?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:82: Have they not traveled through the earth and seen how was the fate of those before them? Most of them were more in numbers than these, and superior in vigor and vestiges left on the earth. So then, whatever they used to earn did not work for them at all.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:83: When their messengers came to them with manifest signs, they exulted because of whatever knowledge they had, and they were encircled by what they used to ridicule.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:84: When they saw Our punishment, they said, “We have (now) come to believe in Allah alone, and We have rejected everything we used to ascribe (to Him) as partners.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 40:85: But, their profession of faith was not (competent) to benefit them, once they had seen Our punishment - a customary practice of Allah that has been there all along in the matter of His servants - and hence, the disbelievers became the losers.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:1: Ha, Mim. (Only Allah and the Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him] know the real meaning.)
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:2: The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Almighty, All-Knowing,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:3: The Forgiver of sin, the Acceptor of repentance, the Severe in tormenting, the Lord of bounty; there is no God but He; towards Him (all) are to return.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:4: No one disputes about the Revelations of Allah except those who do not believe. So let not their moving about (freely) in the cities delude you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:5: Before them the people of Nuh (Noah) and after them many (other) communities rejected (their Messengers). And every people intended to seize its Messenger (to assassinate or imprison him), and raised dispute through baseless issues to dilute (the influence of) the truth by means of that (dispute). So I seized them (in torment). So how was (My) torment!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:6: That is how the judgment of your Lord was fulfilled against those who disbelieved. Surely, they are the inmates of Hell.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:7: The angels who are bearing the Throne and those who are around it, (all) glorify their Lord with His praise and believe in Him and pray for forgiveness of the believers (and submit): ‘O our Lord, You encompass everything in (Your) mercy and knowledge. So forgive those who turn to You in repentance and follow Your path and protect them from the torment of Hell.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:8: O our Lord! And admit them to the Gardens of Eden (for eternal living) You have promised them. And (also admit with them) the pious ones of their fathers and their wives and their children. Surely, You are Almighty, Most Wise.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:9: And save them from (the punishment of) sins. And the one You have saved from (the punishment of) sins that Day, You have indeed shown him great mercy. And that is great success indeed.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:10: Surely, the disbelievers will be called out and addressed: ‘(Today) Allah’s displeasure with you is greater than your own disgust for yourselves whilst you used to deny when called to believe.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:11: They will say: ‘O our Lord, You have caused us to die twice and You have (also) given us life twice. (Now) we confess our sins. So is there any way out (to escape from this chastisement)?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:12: (It will be said to them: ‘No,) this (eternal punishment) is because, when Allah alone was called upon, you used to deny, but when (something) was associated with Him, you used to believe. So (now) the command is Allah’s alone, Who is Most High, Supreme.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:13: He is the One Who shows you His signs and sends down sustenance for you from the heaven. And only he who remains inclined (to Allah alone) accepts advice.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:14: So worship Allah for His own sake in sincere obedience and true devotion, even though the disbelievers may despise it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:15: The Exalter of Ranks and the Owner of the Mighty Throne, He sends His Spirit (i.e., Revelation) upon whomever of His servants He wills by His command, so that He warns them (people) of the Day of Assembly,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:16: The Day when they all will come forth (from the graves), and nothing of their (deeds) will remain hidden from Allah, (He will say:) ‘Whose is the Kingdom this Day?’ (It will be further added:) ‘It belongs to Allah, the One, the Most Dominant.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:17: Today every soul will be rewarded for what it has earned. There will be no injustice Today. Surely, Allah is Swift in taking an account.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:18: And warn them of the Day of impending calamity when hearts will rise to throats due to the suppressed grief. The wrongdoers will have neither any kind friend nor any influential intercessor.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:19: He knows the treacherous eyes, and also those secrets which the breasts hide (inside them).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:20: And Allah judges with truth, and the (idols) they worship other than Allah can judge nothing at all. Surely, Allah is the One Who is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:21: And have they not travelled in the land so that they could see what was the end of those who were before them? They were far mightier in power than these and (also) greater in their remains and signs (which they left behind) in the earth. Then Allah seized them for their sins, and there was none to protect them from (the torment of) Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:22: That was because their Messengers brought them open signs but they denied. So Allah seized them (in the torment). Surely, He is All-Powerful, Most Severe in punishing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:23: And indeed We sent Musa (Moses) with Our signs and a clear authority,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:24: Towards Pharaoh, Haman and Qarun (Korah) but they said: ‘He is a sorcerer, a great liar.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:25: Then when he came to them with the message of truth from Us, they said: ‘Kill the sons of those who have believed with him but leave their women alive.’ And the treacherous plots of the disbelievers were nothing but ruination. (They massacred the generations of peaceful community.)
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:26: And (blind to his own transgression, tyranny and brutality) Pharaoh said: ‘Leave me to kill Musa (Moses) and let him call his Lord. I fear he will change your religion or will spread violence in the country (Egypt).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:27: And Musa (Moses) said: ‘I have taken refuge with my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant character who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:28: And a believing man amongst the people of Pharaoh who had kept his faith secret said, ‘Do you kill a man (just) because he says: Allah is my Lord? And he has brought you clear signs from your Lord. And (suppose) if he is a liar, then the burden of his lie will fall back on him alone, but if he is truthful, then as much torment is bound to seize you as he has promised you. Surely, Allah does not give guidance to someone who exceeds limits and is a downright liar.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:29: O my people! You are in power today; (it is you who) are ruling over the land (of Egypt). But who can save us from the torment of Allah if that (torment) comes upon us?’ Pharaoh said: ‘I instruct you only what I myself deem (correct), and I do not show you (any path) except the path of righteousness.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:30: And he who had embraced faith said: ‘O my people, I fear (the torment of) an evil day coming upon you (too) like the day that seized (the former) generations,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:31: On the pattern of the punishment of the people of Nuh (Noah), ‘Ad and Thamud and the later communities. And Allah does not intend any injustice to (His) servants.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:32: And, O people, I fear for you a Day of Hue and Cry (i.e., the Day of Rising),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:33: The Day when you will turn your backs and flee away, and there will be no one to save you from (the torment of) Allah, and for him whom Allah holds astray there is no guide or leader.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:34: And, (O people of Egypt,) no doubt Yusuf (Joseph) came to you with clear signs before this. And you always remained doubtful about those (signs) which he brought to you until, when he passed away, you started saying: ‘Now Allah will never send any Messenger after him.’ In like manner, Allah holds one astray who is a transgressor and a sceptic,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:35: Those who argue about the Revelations of Allah without any proof that has come to them, (their argumentation) is awfully displeasing in the sight of Allah and in the sight of believers. That is how Allah seals up the heart of every arrogant (and) tyrant.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:36: And Pharaoh said: ‘O Haman, build me a towering palace so that (climbing it) I may reach the tracts,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:37: The tracts to the heavens; then I may peer and glance at the God of Musa (Moses); and I consider him but a liar.’ And in this way, the evil conduct of Pharaoh was made charming for him and he was hindered from the path (of Allah). And the treacherous plan of Pharaoh was nothing but a catastrophe.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:38: And the man who had believed said: ‘O my people, follow me, I will lead you to the path of guidance and piousness.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:39: O my people! The life of this world is nothing but (a few days’) gain, and the Hereafter is certainly a home to live in forever.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:40: He who commits evil will not be rewarded but with the same measure. And whoever behaves piously, whether male or female, and is a believer as well, it is they who will enter Paradise. There they will be given sustenance without measure.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:41: And, O my people, why is it that I call you to salvation and you call me to Hell?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:42: You invite me to deny Allah, and associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge, whilst I invite you to the Almighty God, Who is Most Forgiving.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:43: The truth is that what you are calling me to is not worth calling either in this world or in the Hereafter. And surely, our return is to Allah alone, and certainly those who transgress are the inmates of Hell.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:44: So you will soon recall (these words) that I am saying to you. And I consign my affair to Allah. Surely, Allah is Ever-Watchful of the servants.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:45: Then Allah safeguarded him against their evils which they were planning. And an evil torment engulfed the people of Pharaoh.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:46: They are brought before the Fire of Hell morning and evening. And the Day when Resurrection occurs (a voice will command:) ‘Cast the people of Pharaoh into the most miserable chastisement.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:47: And when they will fall out with one another in Hell, the weak will say to those who used to show arrogance (in the world): ‘We were your followers, so can you remove from us (even) a portion of the Fire of Hell?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:48: Those who practised arrogance will say: ‘We all are doomed in the same Hell; surely, Allah has given His final judgment amongst the servants.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:49: And those burning in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell: ‘Pray to your Lord that He lessens our torment some day.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:50: They will say: ‘Did your Messengers not come to you with clear signs?’ They will reply: ‘Yes, of course.’ (Then the keepers) will say: ‘So pray yourselves.’ But the disbelievers’ prayer will (always) be in vain.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:51: Surely, We help Our Messengers and those who believe both in the life of this world and on the Day when the witnesses will rise,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:52: The Day when the excuse of the wrongdoers will not benefit them. And there will be the curse on them, and for them will be the evil home (in Hell).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:53: And verily We gave Musa ([Moses] the Book of) guidance, and (after him) We made the Children of Israel the inheritors of that (Book),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:54: A guidance and a reminder for those who possess wisdom.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:55: So keep patience. Assuredly, the promise of Allah is true. And ask forgiveness for the sins of your Umma (Community),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:56: Surely, those who argue about the Revelations of Allah without any authority having come to them, there is nothing in their breasts except vain superiority; they will never be able to attain to that (true superiority). So keep seeking refuge with Allah (from their evil). Surely, He alone is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:57: Surely, the creation of the heavens and the earth is far greater than the creation of mankind but most people do not know.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:58: And the blind and the seeing cannot be equal. So (in the same way) those who believe and do righteous works and the evildoers cannot be (alike). You accept direction and guidance but little.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:59: Surely, the Last Hour is bound to come. There is no doubt in that. Yet most people do not believe.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:60: And your Lord has said: ‘Always pray to Me; I shall certainly grant your prayer. Surely, those who turn away from My worship in defiance will soon enter Hell disgraced.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:61: Allah is the One Who has made the night for you to repose in and brightened the day to see; surely, Allah is Bountiful to mankind but most people do not give thanks.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:62: That is Allah, your Lord, Who is the Creator of everything. There is no God apart from Him. So where are you wandering disorientated?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:63: Likewise, those who used to deny the Revelations of Allah were wandering distracted.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:64: Allah is the One Who made the earth a dwelling place for you and the heaven a ceiling and gave you form and features and then perfected your shapes and granted you sustenance of pure things. Such is Allah, your Lord. So Blessed is Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:65: He is the Ever-Living. There is no God but He. So worship Him, making obedience and devotion sincerely His. All praise belongs to Allah alone, the Lord of all the worlds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:66: Say: ‘I have been forbidden to worship those idols that you worship apart from Allah, whereas manifest signs have come to me from my Lord, and I have been commanded to obey the Lord of all the worlds.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:67: He is the One Who initiated (the genesis of) your (chemical life) from clay, then (your biological genesis) from a sperm drop (zygote), then from a hanging mass (in the mother’s womb). Then (eventually) He is the One Who brings you forth as an infant, then (nourishes you), so that you may reach your maturity. (Then He grants you a period of life) so that you may grow old. And some of you die early (before senility). And (the purpose of all this is) that you may complete your respective appointed terms and (also) that you may comprehend.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:68: He is the One Who gives life and causes death. Then when He decides upon a thing, He says to it only: ‘Be,’ so it becomes.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:69: Have you not seen those who argue about the Revelations of Allah? Where are they straying?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:70: Those who have rejected the Book (as well as) the signs with which We sent Our Messengers, they will know (their end) soon,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:71: When they have iron collars round their necks and chains, and they will be dragged away,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:72: Into the boiling water and then will be thrown into the Fire as fuel.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:73: Then it will be said to them: ‘Where are those (idols) which you used to set up as partners,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:74: Apart from Allah?’ They will say: ‘They have been lost from us. In fact, we never worshipped anything before.’ That is how Allah holds the disbelievers astray.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:75: This (punishment) is the requital of your undue rejoicing in the earth and the recompense of your gloating.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:76: Enter the gates of Hell. You will live in it forever. So how evil is the abode of the arrogant!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:77: So keep patience. Surely, Allah’s promise is true. Then whether We show you a portion of that (torment) which We have promised them, or make you depart from the visible life before that, (in both cases) they will be returned to Us.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:78: And no doubt We sent many Messengers before you. We have given you an account of some of them whilst We have not (yet) narrated to you the annals of some others. And it was not possible for any Messenger to bring any sign without Allah’s leave. Then when the command of Allah came (and) the judgment was given with truth and justice, the exponents of evil went into loss.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:79: Allah is the One Who has created cattle for you so that you may ride some of them and some of them you eat.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:80: And in them are for you other benefits too. So you may ride them (further) to reach that desired (place) which is (determined) in your hearts, and (that) you are borne on them and the boats.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:81: And He shows you (many of) His signs. So which of Allah’s signs will you deny?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:82: So have they not travelled in the earth that they could see how they who passed before them met their fate? They were far greater (in number) than these people and mightier in power and (much more advanced) in respect of the remains and traces (as well) that (they) have left behind in the earth (as archeological sites). But whatever they used to earn brought them no benefit.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:83: So when their Messengers came to them with manifest signs, they kept rejoicing in the pride of (the worldly) knowledge and skill they possessed. And (in the same state) that torment which they used to mock engulfed them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:84: But when they saw Our torment, they started saying: ‘We believe in Allah, the One, and reject (all) those we used to associate with Him as partners.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 40:85: Then their acceptance of faith could not profit them at all whilst they had seen Our torment. That is Allah’s way which has always been in practice in respect of His servants, and the disbelievers always suffered heavy loss at this juncture.

null.verse 40:2: Kirjoituksen on ilmoittanut Jumala, jonka on mahti ja tieto,
null.verse 40:3: joka antaa vikamme anteeksi ja kuulee katumuksemme, rankaisee ankarasti, Jalo Herra; ei ole muuta Jumalaa kuin Hän, Hänen luokseen kaikki palaa.
null.verse 40:4: Jumalan ilmoituksista kiistelevät vain ne, jotka eivät usko: älä sentähden anna sen johtaa sinua harhaan, että he menestyvät maailmassa.
null.verse 40:5: Ennen heitä Nooan kansa ja jälkeentulevat sukupolvet hylkäsivät profeetat; joka kansalla on ollut surmanhankkeita sananjulistajiaan vastaan, ja ne ovat taistelleet valheen avulla tehdäkseen tyhjäksi totuuden. Siksi tuhosin heidät, millainen olikaan silloin Minun kostoni!
null.verse 40:6: Näin osoittautui todeksi uskottomia vastaan se Herrasi sana, että he joutuvat tulen omiksi.
null.verse 40:7: Ne, joille on uskottu valta, ja ne, jotka ympäröivät Häntä, julistavat Herransa kunniaa, uskovat Häneen ja anovat varjelusta uskovaisille: »Herra, Sinä suljet kaiken armoosi ja tietoosi; varjele sentähden niitä, jotka kääntyvät puoleesi ja noudattavat tietäsi; säästä heidät helvetin rangaistuksesta.
null.verse 40:8: Herra, salli heidän asettua niihin ikiaikojen tarhoihin, jotka olet luvannut heille ja niille heidän isillensä, vaimoillensa ja jälkeläisillensä, jotka tekevät hyvää. Totisesti, Sinun on mahti ja viisaus.
null.verse 40:9: Pidätä heidät pahoista teoista! » Sillä sen, joka tässä ajassa pahaa karttaa, Sinä todella armahdat tuomion päivänä; niin, se on suurin autuus.
null.verse 40:10: Totisesti huudetaan niille, jotka eivät usko: »Jumalan viha teitä kohtaan on suurempi kuin omanne, koska teidät kutsuttiin uskoon, mutta te sen hylkäsitte.»
null.verse 40:11: He sanovat: »Herra, kaksi kertaa olet pannut meidät kuolemaan ja kaksi kertaa olet antanut meille elämän; me tunnustamme syntimme, mutta onko nyt meille pelastuksen tietä?»
null.verse 40:12: Näin kävi siksi, että te ette uskoneet, kun oli palveltava yksin Jumalaa; mutta uskoitte kyllä, jos joku muu asetettiin Hänen rinnalleen. Tuomio kuuluu Jumalalle, korkealle, suurelle.
null.verse 40:13: Yksin Hän näyttää teille merkkinsä ja lähettää teille antimensa taivaasta, mutta vain se ottaa niistä vaarin, joka turvautuu Häneen.
null.verse 40:14: Huutakaa siis Jumalaa avuksi ollen Hänelle vilpittömän kuuliaiset, vaikka uskottomat olisivatkin nurjamielisiä.
null.verse 40:15: Hän, joka on kaikkien arvojen yläpuolella, Herra, jolla on valta, lähettää oman henkensä voiman otolliselle palvelijalleen, jotta tämä varoittaisi ihmisiä tuomiopäivästä,
null.verse 40:16: siitä päivästä, jolloin heidän on astuttava esiin. Mikään heidän ajatuksensa ei pysy Jumalalta salassa. Kuka hallitsee tuona päivänä? Jumala, ainoa, kaikkivaltias.
null.verse 40:17: Sinä päivänä jokainen sielu palkitaan ansionsa mukaan; vääryyttä ei kellekään tehdä tuona päivänä. Totisesti, Jumala tekee tilinsä nopeasti.
null.verse 40:18: Ja varoita heitä lähestyvästä päivästä, jolloin sydän nousee kurkkuun sisäisestä ahdingosta. Jumalattomilla ei ole yhtään ystävää eikä puoltajaa, jota kuunneltaisiin.
null.verse 40:19: Hän tuntee silmien vilpin ja sen, mitä mieleen on kätketty.
null.verse 40:20: Jumalan tuomio on vanhurskas, mutta ne, joiden puoleen he kääntyvät Hänen asemestaan, eivät saata lainkaan tuomita; totisesti Jumala on kuuleva, näkevä.
null.verse 40:21: Eivätkö he ole kiertäneet maata ja nähneet, minkälainen on ollut niiden loppu, jotka elivät ennen heitä? Ne olivat aikanaan mahtavampia voimiltaan ja varustuksiltaan kuin nämä, mutta Jumala tuhosi heidät heidän syntiensä tähden; ja heillä ei ollut yhtään puolustajaa Jumalaa vastaan.
null.verse 40:22: Tämä tapahtui siksi, että vaikka sananjulistajat tulivat heidän luokseen selvin todistuksin, he torjuivat ne, ja niin Jumala löi heidät; totisesti Hän on väkevä ja ankara tilinteossaan.
null.verse 40:23: Olemme lähettänyt Mooseksen tunnusmerkkeinemme ja selvin valtuuksin
null.verse 40:24: faraon, Haamanin ja Korahin luo, mutta he sanoivat: »Hän on valehtelija ja noita.»
null.verse 40:25: Kun hän näin toi heille Meiltä totuuden sanoman, sanoivat he: »Surmatkaa niiden pojat, jotka uskovat samoin kuin hän, mutta jättäkää naiset henkiin!» Mutta uskottomien juonet raukesivat tyhjiin.
null.verse 40:26: Ja farao sanoi: »Odottakaa, niin surmaan Mooseksen, ja huutakoon hän avuksi Herraansa! Totisesti pelkään, että hän turmelee uskontonne tai saa aikaan epäjärjestystä maassa.»
null.verse 40:27: Ja Mooses sanoi omilleen, »Totisesti turvaudun Herraani ja teidän Herraanne jokaista vastaan, joka ylpeilee eikä usko tuomion päivään.»
null.verse 40:28: Silloin sanoi eräs faraon väkeen kuuluva uskova mies, joka salasi uskontonsa: »Surmaatteko miehen sentähden, että hän sanoo: 'Jumala on Herrani?' Hän on totisesti tuonut teille selvät todistukset Herralta. Jos hän valehtelee, lankeaa valhe hänen päällensä, mutta jos hän puhuu totta, niin teille koituu jotakin siitä, millä hän teitä uhkaa. Totisesti, Jumala ei ohjaa sitä, joka on pöyhkeäsanainen ja petollinen.
null.verse 40:29: Kansalaiseni, tänä päivänä on herruus ja valta maassa teidän, mutta kuka auttaa meitä välttymään Jumalan rangaistuksesta, jos se meidät kohtaa?» Mutta farao sanoi: »En neuvo teille muuta kuin sitä, mitä itse pidän hyvänä, enkä kehoita teitä seuraamaan muuta kuin oikeata tietä.»
null.verse 40:30: Mutta tuo uskovainen sanoi: »Kansalaiseni, pelkään teille tapahtuvan jotakin sellaista kuin samanmielisille,
null.verse 40:31: niinkuin tapahtui Nooan kansalle, Aadille, Tamuudille ja niille, jotka elivät heidän jälkeensä; Jumala ei tahdo vääryyttä tehtävän palvelijoilleen.
null.verse 40:32: Kansani, pelkään puolestanne viimeistä tuomiota,
null.verse 40:33: päivää, jolloin käännytte pakoon eikä teillä ole ketään, joka pelastaisi teidät Jumalan vihalta, sillä kenen Jumala antaa kulkea harhaan, sillä ei ole lainkaan opasta.
null.verse 40:34: Totisesti on Joosef tullut aikaisemmin luoksenne selvin todistuksin, mutta te yhä epäilitte hänen sanomaansa, aina siihen saakka, kunnes hän kuoli ja te sanoitte: »Jumala ei enää milloinkaan hänen jälkeensä lähetä sananjulistajaa». Näin saattaa Jumala pöyhkeäsanaiset ja epäilijät harhaan.
null.verse 40:35: Niitä, jotka kiistelevät Jumalan ilmoituksista saamatta Häneltä siihen valtaa, kohtaa ankarana Jumalan ja uskovien viha. Näin sinetöi Jumala jokaisen pöyhkeän ja ylenkatseisen sydämen.
null.verse 40:36: Ja farao sanoi: »Haaman, rakenna minulle torni, jotta minulla olisi tie
null.verse 40:37: ja pääsy taivaaseen saavuttaakseni Mooseksen Jumalan; totisesti pidän häntä valehtelijana.» Näin näyttivät faraosta hänen pahat tekonsa kauniilta ja hän eksyi tieltä; mutta faraon juonet johtivat vain turmioon.
null.verse 40:38: Ja tuo uskovainen sanoi: »Kansalaiseni, seuratkaa minua, minä johdan teidät oikealle tielle.
null.verse 40:39: Kansalaiseni, tämän maailman elämä on vain katoavaa iloa, mutta se, mikä tulee tämän jälkeen, on pysyväinen kotimme.
null.verse 40:40: Se, joka tekee pahan teon, saa sen mukaisen palkan; mutta ne, jotka tekevät hyvää ja uskovat, olkoot he sitten miehiä tai naisia, pääsevät paratiisiin, jossa heitä yltäkyllin ravitaan.
null.verse 40:41: Kansalaiseni, miksi kutsun teitä pelastukseen, vaikka te kutsutte minua tuleen?
null.verse 40:42: Te kehoitatte minua kieltämään Jumalan ja asettamaan Hänen rinnalleen jotakin sellaista, mistä minulla ei ole mitään tietoa, mutta minä kutsun teitä Hänen luokseen, jolla on valta ja armahdus.
null.verse 40:43: Varmaa on, että sillä, jonka puoleen minua kutsutte, ei ole valtaa tässä eikä tulevassa maailmassa, ja että me palaamme Jumalan tykö, mutta väärintekijäin asuinpaikka on tuli.
null.verse 40:44: Muistakaa siis, mitä sanon teille, ja minä uskon asiani Jumalan haltuun. Totisesti, Jumala näkee palvelijansa.»
null.verse 40:45: Ja jumala varjeli häntä heidän pahoilta juoniltaan, ja mitä ankarin rangaistus kohtasi faraon kansan.
null.verse 40:46: Tulen eteen viedään heidät joka aamu ja ilta, ja sinä päivänä, jolloin hetki lyö, julistetaan: »Faraon kansalle antakaa pahin rangaistus!»
null.verse 40:47: Ja kun he riitelevät toinen toisensa kanssa tulessa, sanovat heikot ylvästelijöille: »Totisesti, me olimme teidän seuraajianne; ettekö siis tahdo ottaa meiltä osaa tulen tuskasta?»
null.verse 40:48: Ne, jotka ovat ylpeitä, sanovat: »Totisesti, me olemme kaikki samassa kadotuksessa; Jumala on totisesti jakanut oikeuttaan palvelijoillensa.»
null.verse 40:49: Ja ne, jotka ovat tulessa, sanovat helvetin kaitsijoille: »Anokaa Herraltanne, että Hän lievittäisi kuritustamme edes yhdellä päivällä.»
null.verse 40:50: Nämä vastaavat: »Eivätkö apostolinne ole tulleet tykönne selvin todistein?» He sanovat: »Kyllä», ja vartijat sanovat: »Siis huutakaa apua.» Mutta uskottomien huuto menee hukkaan.
null.verse 40:51: Apostoleitamme ja niitä, jotka uskovat, Me totisesti autamme tämän maailman elämässä ja sinä päivänä, jolloin todistajat nousevat ylös.
null.verse 40:52: Sinä päivänä, jolloin ei auta jumalattomia heidän anteeksipyyntönsä, vaan näiden osana on kirous ja kurja paikka.
null.verse 40:53: Totisesti olemme antanut Moosekselle johdatuksen ja Israelin lapsille perinnöksi pyhän Kirjan.
null.verse 40:54: Ohjeeksi ja muistutukseksi niille, jotka ymmärtävät.
null.verse 40:55: Ole sentähden kärsivällinen. Jumalan lupaus on varmasti tosi; pyydä varjelusta synneistäsi kiittäen ja ylistäen Herraasi aamuin ja illoin.
null.verse 40:56: Ne, jotka ilman valtuutta kiistelevät Jumalan merkeistä, ovat mielessään pelkkää ylpeyttä täynnä ja himoitsevat suuruutta, jota he eivät milloinkaan saavuta. Etsi sentähden turvaa Jumalasta; totisesti Hän on näkevä ja kuuleva.
null.verse 40:57: Totisesti, taivaan ja maan luominen on enemmän kuin ihmisen luominen, mutta useimmat ihmiset ovat tietoa vailla.
null.verse 40:58: Sokea ja näkevä eivät ole toistensa kaltaisia, eivätkä ne, jotka uskovat ja tekevät hyvää, ole pahantekijän kaltaisia. Vähäistä on vaarinottonne.
null.verse 40:59: Totisesti, hetki tulee, siitä ei ole epäilystä, mutta useimmat ihmiset eivät usko.
null.verse 40:60: Teidän Herranne sanoo: »Kutsukaa Minua, Minä vastaan teille; totisesti, ne, jotka ovat liian ylpeitä palvelemaan Minua, joutuvat pian masennettuina helvettiin.»
null.verse 40:61: Jumala teille loi yön levoksi ja päivän silmienne valoksi, totisesti on Jumala ihmisille armollinen, mutta useimmat ihmiset ovat kiittämättömiä.
null.verse 40:62: Tämä on Jumala, teidän Herranne, kaiken Luoja; ei ole muuta jumalaa kuin Hän. Miksi siis käännytte Hänestä pois?
null.verse 40:63: Niin hylkäsivät Hänet myös ne, jotka kielsivät Jumalan ilmoitukset.
null.verse 40:64: Jumala loi maan leposijaksenne ja taivaan sille katokseksi; Hän antoi teille muodon, teki muotonne kauniiksi ja jakeli teille hyvyyttä. Tämä on Jumala, teidän Herranne; siunattu on siis Jumala, maailmojen valtias.
null.verse 40:65: Hän on elävä, ei ole muuta Jumalaa kuin Hän. Kutsukaa siis Häntä, ollen Hänelle vilpittömiä ja kuuliaisia. Ylistys olkoon Jumalalle, maailmojen valtiaalle.
null.verse 40:66: Sano: »Minua on kielletty palvelemasta niitä, joita te Jumalan ohella avuksi huudatte, koska Herra on antanut minulle selvät todistukset ja olen saanut käskyn alistua koko maailman Herran tahtoon.»
null.verse 40:67: Hän on luonut teidät tomusta, sitten pienestä elämänidusta, sitten hyytyneestä verestä; sitten saattaa Hän teidät lapseksi saavuttaaksenne senjälkeen kypsyysiän ja sitten vanhuuden, vaikka joukossanne on muutamia, joiden on kuoltava sitä ennen; näin saavutatte määrätyn ajan, jotta ymmärtäisitte.
null.verse 40:68: Hän se antaa elämän ja lähettää kuoleman; kun Hän päättää jotakin, Hän sanoo vain: »Tulkoon!» ja niin tapahtuu.
null.verse 40:69: Etkö ole nähnyt, kuinka ne, jotka väittelevät Jumalan ilmoituksista, ovat harhaan johdettuja?
null.verse 40:70: Ne, jotka hylkäävät pyhän Kirjan ja sen sanoman, jonka Me olemme lähettänyt sananjulistajamme mukana, tulevat pian huomaamaan erehdyksensä,
null.verse 40:71: kun kahleet ja vitjat pannaan heidän kaulaansa ja heidät raastetaan
null.verse 40:72: kuumaan veteen ja senjälkeen kärvennetään tulella.
null.verse 40:73: Silloin heille sanotaan: »Missä on se, joka teidän oli tapana asettaa Jumalan rinnalle?»
null.verse 40:74: He sanovat: »Ne ovat pettäneet meidät; ei, meillä ei ennen ollut tapana ketään palvella.» Näin Jumala johtaa harhaan uskottomat.
null.verse 40:75: Sillä ilonne maailmassa oli jumalatonta ja käytöksenne pöyhkeätä.
null.verse 40:76: Astukaa sisään helvetin porteista jäädäksenne sinne. Kurja on ylpeäin olinpaikka.
null.verse 40:77: Ole siis kärsivällinen, Jumalan lupaus on totisesti varma. Joko annamme sinun nähdä osan siitä, millä heitä uhkaamme, tai otamme sinut pois, heidän on palattava Meidän tykömme.
null.verse 40:78: Totisesti Me lähetimme sananjulistajia ennen sinua; heidän joukossaan on muutamia, joista olemme sinulle ilmoittanut, ja toisia, joista emme ole sinulle ilmoittanut. Apostolin ei ollut sallittu antaa merkkejä ilman Jumalan lupaa. Kun Jumalan käsky tulee, silloin tuomio totisesti toimeenpannaan, ja ne, jotka pitävät sitä valheena, ovat tuhon omia.
null.verse 40:79: Jumala teille antoi kotieläimet ratsastaaksenne toisilla niistä ja toisista saadaksenne ravintonne.
null.verse 40:80: Niistä on teille hyötyä, niiden avulla toimitatte asianne, sillä ne sekä laivat kantavat teitä.
null.verse 40:81: Hän osoittaa teille tunnusmerkkinsä. Minkä Jumalan merkeistä tahdotte kieltää?
null.verse 40:82: Eivätkö he ole kiertäneet maata ja nähneet, millainen oli niiden loppu, jotka elivät ennen heitä? Nämä olivat maan päällä lukuisammat kuin he ja suuremmat voimaltaan ja varustuksiltaan, mutta heidän saavutuksensa eivät heitä hyödyttäneet.
null.verse 40:83: Kun sitten heidän apostolinsa tulivat heidän luokseen selvin todistuksin, he pöyhkeilivät tiedoillaan, ja se, mitä he ivasivat, kohtasi heitä itseänsä.
null.verse 40:84: Mutta kun he näkivät Meidän kurituksemme, he sanoivat: »Me uskomme vain Jumalaan ja kiellämme sen, minkä asetimme Hänen rinnalleen.»
null.verse 40:85: Mutta heidän uskonsa ei heitä enää hyödyttänyt, kun he jo olivat kokeneet Meidän kostomme. Tämä on Jumalan laki, joka on ollut tehokas Hänen palvelijoihinsa nähden, mutta uskottomat ovat tuhon omat.

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:2: La Révélation du Livre vient de Dieu, le Puissant, l'Omniscient,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:3: Celui qui pardonne le péché, Celui qui accueille le repentir, Celui qui est rigoureux dans Son châtiment, Celui qui est plein de longanimité. Il n'y a de Dieu que Lui ! Vers Lui s'accomplira le retour.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:4: Seuls les mécréants disputent sur les signes de Dieu. Que l'agitation qu'ils entretiennent dans ce pays ne te trouble pas !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:5: Avant eux, le peuple de Noé et, par la suite, les factieux ont crié au mensonge. Les membres de chaque communauté ont conçu le dessein de s'emparer de leur envoyé ! Ils ont usé d'arguments faux pour rejeter la Vérité. Je les ai donc saisis. Quel a été alors Mon châtiment !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:6: Ainsi s'est réalisée la sentence de ton Seigneur contre les mécréants : ils sont les hôtes du Feu.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:7: Ceux qui portent le Trône et ceux qui l'entourent célèbrent les louanges de leur Seigneur. Ils croient en Lui et demandent pardon pour les croyants : " Notre Seigneur ! Tu embrasses toute chose en Ta Miséricorde et en Ta Science ; pardonne donc à ceux qui suivent Ton chemin, et épargne-leur le châtiment de la Fournaise !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:8: Notre Seigneur ! Introduis-les dans les Jardins d'Eden que Tu leur as promis, ainsi que ceux de leurs pères, de leurs épouses et de leurs descendants qui ont été vertueux. Tu es le Puissant, le Sage !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:9: Et préserve-les des mauvaises actions ; car celui que Tu préserves aujourd'hui des mauvaises actions, Tu lui fais miséricorde ; et c'est là le bonheur suprême ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:10: Ceux qui mécroient s'entendront dire : " La haine de Dieu envers vous est plus grande que votre haine envers vous-mêmes, lorsque vous avez été appelés à la foi et que vous avez mécru ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:11: Ils diront : " Notre Seigneur ! Tu nous as fait mourir deux fois et deux fois Tu nous a fait revivre. Nous reconnaissons nos péchés ; existe-t-il une issue hors de ce sentier ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:12: Il en est ainsi parce que lorsque Dieu, l'Unique, était invoqué, vous avez mécru ; mais si des associés Lui sont donnés, vous y croyez. Le Jugement appartient à Dieu, le Très- Haut, l'infiniment Grand !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:13: C'est Lui qui vous montre Ses signes et qui, pour vous, fait descendre du ciel une nourriture. Mais seul celui qui se repent est capable de réfléchir.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:14: Implorez Dieu, Lui rendant un culte pur, n'en déplaise aux mécréants !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:15: Lui qui élève aux degrés sublimes, le Maître du Trône, Il projette l'Esprit qui vient de Son commandement sur qui Il veut parmi Ses serviteurs afin d'avertir du Jour de la rencontre,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:16: du Jour où ils comparaîtront. Rien de ce qui les concerne ne sera caché pour Dieu. " A qui le Royaume appartiendra-t-il en ce jour ? A Dieu, l'Unique, l'Invincible ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:17: Ce Jour-là, toute âme sera rétribuée pour ce qu'elle aura accompli. Nulle ne sera lésée. Dieu est prompt à faire le compte.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:18: Avertis-les du Jour prochain où les cœurs monteront à la gorge jusqu'à l'oppresser. Les iniques ne trouveront ni ami zélé, ni intercesseur crédible.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:19: Dieu connaît la perfidie des regards et ce que les cœurs recèlent.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:20: Dieu prononce Ses arrêts selon la Vérité, mais ceux qu'ils invoquent en dehors de Lui ne se prononcent sur rien : Dieu seul est Celui qui entend et voit parfaitement !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:21: Ne parcourent-ils pas la terre et ne voient-ils pas quelle a été la fin de ceux qui les ont précédés ? Ceux-ci étaient bien plus puissants qu'eux par la force et par les traces qu'ils ont laissées sur la terre. Et pourtant, Dieu les a saisis à cause de leurs péchés et rien n'a pu les protéger contre Dieu.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:22: C'est ainsi que leurs envoyés sont venus à eux avec des preuves évidentes et qu'ils ont mécru. Alors, Dieu les a saisis ; certes, Il est fort et redoutable dans Son châtiment !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:23: Nous avons envoyé Moïse avec Nos signes et un pouvoir manifeste,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:24: à Pharaon, à Haman et à Coré. Ils dirent : " C'est un sorcier, un imposteur ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:25: Et quand il leur apporta la Vérité venant de Nous, ils dirent : " Tuez les fils de ceux qui partagent sa foi et laissez vivre leurs femmes ". Mais la ruse des mécréants ne fait que les égarer.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:26: Pharaon dit : " Laissez-moi tuer Moïse et qu'il implore son Seigneur ! Je crains qu'il n'altère votre religion ou qu'il ne répande la subversion dans le pays ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:27: Moïse dit : " J'ai pris refuge auprès de mon Seigneur et du vôtre contre tout orgueilleux qui ne croit pas au Jour du Décompte ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:28: Un homme croyant, qui appartenait au peuple de Pharaon et qui cachait sa foi, dit : " Tuerez-vous un homme parce qu'il a dit : " Mon Seigneur est Dieu ! ", alors qu'il vous a apporté des preuves évidentes de la part de votre Seigneur ? S'il est menteur, son mensonge retombera sur lui, et s'il dit vrai, il tombera sur vous quelque malheur dont il vous menace. Dieu ne dirige pas celui qui est transgresseur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:29: O mon peuple ! La domination vous appartient aujourd'hui et vous exercez tout le pouvoir dans le pays ; mais qui donc nous secourra contre la rigueur de Dieu quand elle nous atteindra ? " Pharaon dit : " Je ne vous fais voir que ce que je vois moi-même, et je ne vous dirige que sur le chemin de la rectitude ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:30: Celui qui était croyant dit : " O mon peuple ! Oui, je crains pour vous un jour semblable à celui des factieux,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:31: un sort semblable à celui du peuple de Noé, des 'Ad, des Thamoud et de ceux qui vécurent après eux. Pourtant, Dieu ne veut pas d'iniquité envers Ses serviteurs !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:32: O mon peuple ! Oui, je crains pour vous le Jour de l'interpellation mutuelle,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:33: le Jour où vous tournerez le dos pour vous enfuir ; il n'y aura alors personne pour vous défendre contre Dieu. Celui que Dieu égare, personne ne le guide ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:34: Déjà Joseph était venu à vous avec des preuves décisives et vous n'aviez pas cessé de mettre en doute ce qu'il vous apportait. Puis, lorsqu'il eut disparu, vous vous êtes exclamés : " Dieu n'enverra plus aucun messager après lui ! " C'est ainsi que Dieu égare celui qui est transgresseur et incrédule,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:35: ceux qui disputent sur les signes de Dieu sans qu'une autorité leur ait été conférée. Ils suscitent une vive réprobation de la part de Dieu et des croyants. C'est ainsi que Dieu met un sceau sur le cœur de tout tyran orgueilleux.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:36: Pharaon dit : " O Haman ! Construis-moi une tour pour que j'essaie d'atteindre les voies,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:37: les voies des cieux, et je grimperai vers le Dieu de Moïse. Mais je pense que celui-ci est un menteur ! " C'est ainsi que la mauvaise action de Pharaon a été enjolivée à ses propres yeux et qu'il a été écarté du bon chemin ; ainsi, la ruse de Pharaon n'a abouti qu'à la ruine.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:38: Celui qui était croyant dit : " O mon peuple ! Suivez-moi ! Je vous guiderai sur le chemin de la rectitude.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:39: O mon peuple ! La vie de ce monde n'est qu'une jouissance éphémère, mais c'est la vie future qui est la demeure de stabilité.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:40: Celui qui fait une mauvaise action ne sera rétribué que par son équivalent. Mais quiconque, homme ou femme, fait le bien en étant croyant, ceux-là entreront au Paradis où des bienfaits leur seront dispensés sans compter.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:41: O mon peuple ! Qu'ai-je à vous appeler au salut, alors que vous m'appelez au Feu ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:42: Vous m'appelez à mécroire en Dieu et à Lui associer ce dont je n'ai aucune connaissance, mais moi, je vous appelle vers le seul Puissant, Celui qui pardonne généreusement.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:43: Il n'est pas douteux que ce vers quoi vous m'appelez n'a nul droit d'être imploré ni en ce monde, ni dans l'autre, que notre retour sera vers Dieu et que les transgresseurs sont les hôtes du Feu.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 40:44: Vous vous souviendrez de ce que je vous dis. Je confie mon sort à Dieu, car Dieu voit parfaitement Ses serviteurs ".
